0.title: 34-hour wait at -5°C was worst part: Bihar student on return from Ukraine
0.article_body: A Bihar resident who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday said the worst part was the 34-hour wait at the Ukraine-Romania border. "I couldn't eat, drink or sleep. The temperature was -3°C to -5°C," the 21-year-old student added. He further said that there was no toilet or place to sleep and he saw some girls falling unconscious.

1.title: Reaffirms commitment to service: Odisha CM on BJD win in rural polls
1.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday said that the massive mandate for the BJD in the three-tier panchayat elections has strengthened the party's commitment to public service. The BJD has won in 766 of the 851 Zilla Parishad zones where the elections were held. "I thank the people from the core of my heart for their...support to...BJD candidates," Patnaik tweeted.

2.title: Shahid Kapoor charges ₹38 cr for film with Ali Abbas Zafar: Report
2.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has reportedly charged ₹38 crore as his fee for his upcoming untitled action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar. "This is around 25% more than 'Jersey' and more than twice of what he had fetched for...'Kabir Singh'," a trade source told Bollywood Hungama. Shahid Kapoor began shooting for the film in November last year.

3.title: Pakistan-Australia series set to be played with 100% crowd capacity
3.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has been allowed by National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC) to conduct the all-format series between Pakistan and Australia in front of a 100% capacity crowd due to reduction in COVID-19 cases across the country. The series is scheduled to take place from March 4 to April 5, 2022, beginning with the first Test in Rawalpindi.

4.title: Dean of Kerala drama school arrested for raping student in his home
4.article_body: School of Drama and Fine Arts' Dean S Sunil Kumar was arrested in Thrissur on Tuesday for allegedly raping a student in his home on January 21. The victim lived with Kumar and his partner as she couldn't travel to her hometown. After the victim allegedly attempted suicide and mentioned the incident in the hospital, Kumar called her "mentally unstable".

5.title: We've a desire to see our kids alive, I think it's a fair one: Zelenskyy to EU
5.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the European Parliament on Tuesday, the sixth day of the Russian invasion. Appealing to the European Union to "prove you're with us", Zelenskyy said, "We have a desire to see our children alive. I think it's a fair one." He added, "We're fighting...for our land...our freedom, despite the fact that all [our] cities...are now blocked."

6.title: At one time, I didn't have ₹1,500 to pay for kid's school: Urvashi
6.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia has revealed that during her late teens, she required ₹3,000 but was paid half as makers said she only shot the first episode. "You feel 'What am I gonna do, I don't have ₹1,500 to pay for my child's education'," the actress added. Urvashi further said that looking back, she feels she has done well for herself.

7.title: Officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees return home: K'taka CM
7.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the state has deployed two officials in Mumbai and New Delhi, to help Karnataka students arriving from Ukraine reach home without any hassle. "The Romanian border is getting crowded and a request has been made to make separate arrangements for Kannadigas," the CM added.

8.title: PM2.5 pollution-related deaths in India rose 2.5 times in 20 yrs: Report
8.article_body: Deaths due to PM2.5 pollution in India increased 2.5 times in the last two decades, according to a report by Centre for Science and Environment. The report, released by Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav, said India accounted for one of every four air pollution-related deaths in 2019. It added that 6.67 million people died due to air pollution in the world.

9.title: This board has no authority to even call my peon: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover
9.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as company's MD and board director, said, "I live life on my own terms. This board has no authority to even call my peon." He said, "I don't acknowledge this board. It's a contravention of every single law of the land." He added, "I will take this up to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs."

10.title: Do prove that you are with us: Ukrainian President asks for support from EU
10.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged the European Union to prove it supported the country amid the Russian invasion. "Do prove that you are with us. Do prove that you will not let us go. Do prove that you are indeed Europeans and then life will win over death and light will win over darkness," he said.

11.title: Hungary supports bid for Ukraine to become part of EU: Minister
11.article_body: Hungary is supporting an initiative by eight European Union (EU) leaders to start membership talks with Ukraine, Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó said on Tuesday, adding that Brussels should "put the issue on agenda". Presidents of Poland, Lithuania, Latvia and five other countries have called for expedited EU candidate status for Ukraine. Ukraine has signed an application to join EU.

12.title: PM Modi to unveil Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Pune on March 6
12.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Pune on March 6 (Sunday) is likely to travel by metro rail and also unveil Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's statue at Pune Municipal Corporation headquarters, BJP office-bearers said. He will also inaugurate the two priority stretches of the metro rail project between Garware college to Vanaz and Dapodi to Pimpri, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

13.title: Rohit Sharma buys personalised Lamborghini Urus worth over ₹3.10 crore, pics surface
13.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has bought a personalised Lamborghini Urus car worth over ₹3.10 crore. The Blu Eleos Metallic Urus comes with a 22-inch Nath diamond-cut rims and Sportivo Leather interior in Nero Ade/Rosso Alala. Rohit also owns a BMW X3, Toyota Fortuner and a Skoda Laura, which was his first-ever car.

14.title: Saurabh Chaudhary wins gold in shooting World Cup, Russian flag removed from points table
14.article_body: India's 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won the gold medal after defeating Germany's Michael Schwald in the final of 10 metre Air Pistol at ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo. The bronze medal in the event was won by Russia's Artem Chernousov. The Russian flag and country's name were removed beside Artem's name over Russia's ongoing war with Ukraine.

15.title: 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman Khan: Boney Kapoor
15.article_body: Bollywood producer Boney Kapoor has said that the sequel to the 2005 film 'No Entry' can only be made with actor Salman Khan. Boney stated that the script of the sequel is ready. "But 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman," he added. Talking about the film's script, Boney said, "It is 10 times funnier than 'No Entry'."

16.title: I'm fond of Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman, Nutan: Yami Gautam
16.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam in an interview has said that she is fond of the acting of veteran actresses Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman and Nutan. The actress was asked about which actresses' career has inspired her. Yami further said that people are unaware of the struggles of actors, adding that she might not want to go through that actress' backstory.

17.title: UP CM Yogi offers prayers at Gorakhnath temple on Maha Shivaratri
17.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath offered prayers at the Gorakhnath temple on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. Pictures have also surfaced online, showing the CM performing a ritual with a group of people inside the temple. Meanwhile, devotees in the state took holy dips and offered their prayers at Magh Mela in Prayagraj early morning on Tuesday.

18.title: Hyd police trace missing purse, hand it over to college student
18.article_body: Hyderabad Police helped trace a college student's purse after she reported it missing in the city's Shamirpet area. The student took to social media to share her experience and said she was helped immediately by the force. SHO of Bollaram police station, P Sreedhar, said ASI Sudarshan Sai and PC Shiva Shanker handed over the belonging to the victim.

19.title: Every minute is precious: Rahul after Indian student killed in Ukraine
19.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said "the government needs a strategic plan for safe evacuation" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. "Every minute is precious," Gandhi tweeted. The Centre recently launched Operation Ganga to evacuate Indians stranded in Ukraine. India has sent four ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid evacuation.

20.title: UP elections appear to be 'chhalia' versus Ballia: Akhilesh Yadav
20.article_body: While addressing an election meeting in the Phephana Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the ongoing Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections seem to be of "chhalia" (deceit) versus Ballia. "The BJP had promised to double the income of farmers if voted to power. Farmers should say if their income has doubled? Are the farmers getting fertilisers?" Yadav added.

21.title: Thailand to deploy labour to Saudi Arabia as bilateral ties normalise
21.article_body: Thailand will facilitate deployment of labour to Saudi Arabia for the first time in decades, its government said on Tuesday. Thai cabinet approved two draft agreements on legal labour recruitment for Saudi Arabia, which will protect the rights of workers and employers, a Thai government spokesperson said. This comes as the two countries agreed to re-establish diplomatic ties in January.

22.title: Philippines ease COVID-19 restrictions amid decline in daily caseload
22.article_body: Philippines on Tuesday relaxed COVID-19 restrictions amid a decline in number of daily cases. As per the ease in norms, public transport, businesses, malls, restaurants and theatres can operate at full capacity. However, the government mandated full vaccination for all residents above 18 and wearing of masks. Meanwhile, Philippines reported 1,067 new cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours.

23.title: NLUD launches new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health
23.article_body: The National Law University, Delhi (NLUD) has launched new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health, and technology law and policy. The courses have been launched by its centres Project39A and Centre for Communication Governance (CCG). Vice-Chancellor Srikrishna Deva Rao said that NLUD's focus, since its inception, "has been to look beyond normative legal studies patterns".

24.title: Over 1 million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines expire in Guatemala
24.article_body: Guatemalan health authorities on Monday said over one million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines have expired as nobody took the doses. There was "rejection" among population towards vaccine, said Health Minister Francisco Coma. However, he added it was unclear if hesitation was over Sputnik V or all vaccines. Meanwhile, only about 43% of the eligible population in Guatemala is fully vaccinated.

25.title: 4 students from B'luru build prototype to extract biodiesel using algae
25.article_body: Four school students from Bengaluru have built a prototype to extract biodiesel using algae. The students found that algae acts as a bioreactor sequester as it can capture and store carbon dioxide and they subsequently used the bioreactor to extract the biodiesel. They discovered that algae can be sustainably farmed from freshwater bodies and double in biomass over 24 hours.

26.title: Farhan Akhtar condoles death of Indian student killed in Ukraine
26.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar on Tuesday took to Twitter to condole the death of the Indian student killed in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. He wrote, "Feel terrible for the family...Hope we can get all our citizens home safe and soon." The Ministry of External Affairs has announced that it is in touch with the family of the student.

27.title: Kiren Rijiju leaves for Slovakia to oversee evacuation of Indians
27.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday boarded a SpiceJet flight for Slovakia to oversee the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "As an envoy of PM Narendra Modi, we'll give his message to PM of Slovakia because without the help of their government we can't conduct this operation," he said. PM Modi spoke to his Slovakian counterpart on Monday.

28.title: Exploring ways to keep space station in orbit sans Russian help: NASA
28.article_body: NASA Human Spaceflight Program's Associate Administrator, Kathy Lueders, on Monday said NASA is exploring ways to keep International Space Station (ISS) in orbit without Russian help. However, she added orbiting research laboratory is yet unaffected by Russian invasion of Ukraine. This comes after Roscosmos chief hinted at pulling out of space partnership last week in response to US sanctions.

29.title: Seals in Antarctica help scientists to collect data under ice sheet
29.article_body: A group of eight Weddell seals helped Japanese researchers to survey waters and collect data such as water temperature and salt levels under thick ice sheet. Seals were equipped with 580g monitoring device on their heads that acted as a temperature and depth sensor. Project leader Nobuo Kokubun said such research helps scientists trace the animals' behavioural patterns and ecology.

30.title: Billionaire Founder of gaming company Nexon dies aged 54 in US
30.article_body: Kim Jung-ju, the billionaire Founder of Nexon, an online gaming company founded in South Korea, died at the age of 54 in United States late last month, Nexon's holding company NXC Corp said in a statement. Kim had been receiving treatment for depression and his condition seemed to have worsened recently, NXC said, without disclosing the cause of his death.

31.title: PM Modi speaks to the father of 21-yr-old Indian Medical student killed in Ukraine
31.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday spoke to the father of 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "I know his family. They are very close to me. PM had spoken to the family. We'll try our best to recover the body and bring it back to India."

32.title: West must not build military facilities in ex-Soviet nations: Russia
32.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that the West must not build military facilities in any countries of the former Soviet Union. Russia found it unacceptable that some European countries hosted US nuclear weapons and was taking measures to prevent Ukraine from acquiring similar weapons, he added. Notably, several countries are sending weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

33.title: Video shows diplomats walking out ahead of Russian minister's speech at UN forum
33.article_body: More than a dozen diplomats walked out ahead of a speech by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at the UN Human Rights Council on Tuesday in protest of its invasion of Ukraine. A video of the incident showed the diplomats walking out as soon as Lavrov's speech starts to play on the screen. Lavrov was addressing the forum remotely.

34.title: 90% Indians who study medicine abroad fail to clear exam here: Minister
34.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday said that 90% of Indian students who go abroad for medical studies fail to clear the qualifying exam in India. He added, "This isn't the right time to debate why students are moving out to study medicine." He said the government is in touch with Ukraine and Russia and will soon bring students home.

35.title: Ukrainian civilians throw Molotov cocktail at Russian tank, video surfaces
35.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed Ukrainian civilians throwing a Molotov cocktail at a Russian tank. In the clip, their car slowly approached the tank and threw the petrol bomb, following which, flames erupted and the car moved out of the area. Earlier, Ukraine had told its residents to make Molotov cocktails to "neutralise the occupier".

36.title: UP was 'BIMARU' before, saw fastest economic growth under BJP: Rajnath
36.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Tuesday that the state was referred to as 'BIMARU' before but achieved fastest economic growth under BJP. "In 2017, UP's economy was at 11 lakh crore...in...last five years, it...breached 31 lakh crore-mark," he added. 'BIMARU' is an acronym for first letters of Bihar, MP, Rajasthan and UP. It also relates to 'sick' in Hindi.

37.title: Watched 2004, 2006 Pak-India series: Labuschagne ahead of Aus tour of Pak
37.article_body: Talking about his preparations for upcoming Australia tour of Pakistan, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said he lately watched a few old matches on YouTube, like Pakistan versus India and England series in 2004 and 2006. "Just to get a gauge on what wickets are like...they spun late and...were good for batting," he added. First Test will begin on March 4.

38.title: 'Only Ukrainians being allowed in trains', says Indian; Vir Das shares messages
38.article_body: An Indian student, trying to take a train from Kyiv-Pasazhyrsky in war-hit Ukraine, was allegedly unable to board as only Ukrainians were being allowed onboard. Her message was amplified by comedian Vir Das who sought MEA's help for the girl. Das shared messages from the girl's sibling who said, "I don't know what I can do for her...she's suffering."

39.title: Hyd may see severe heatwave, flooding in coming months: UN report
39.article_body: Hyderabad may see severe heatwave and flooding in the coming months, a report by UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) predicted. Heatwaves will worsen in the Indian sub-continent and Hyderabad will be directly affected by this, the report's lead author Anjal Prakash said. Hyderabad may also see high-intensity rainfall, including heavy downpours that could flood the city, he added.

40.title: Ukraine's Prez gets standing ovation after his speech at European Parliament
40.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy received a standing ovation after his speech at the European Parliament. "Nobody's going to break us. We're strong...We're Ukrainians. We have a desire to see our children alive. I think it's a fair one," Zelenskyy said. "We're fighting for our land and our freedom despite the fact that all our cities are now blocked," he added.

41.title: Russian, Belarusian badminton players banned from competing until further notice
41.article_body: Badminton World Federation (BWF) announced that it is banning Russian and Belarusian badminton players from competing until further notice. Earlier, BWF cancelled all sanctioned tournaments in Russia and Belarus following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. BWF said it fully supported International Olympic Committee urging sports federations to move or cancel sports events planned in Russia or Belarus.

42.title: Instagram to shut down standalone IGTV app for longer videos
42.article_body: Instagram has announced it will no longer support its standalone IGTV app that served as Instagram's long-form video platform. "We will focus on having all videos on the main Instagram app," Instagram said. Instagram ditched its IGTV (short for Instagram TV) branding in October 2021 when it combined IGTV's long-form videos and Instagram feed videos into a new format.

43.title: He was in grocery queue, no info about his body: Hostel mate on Indian killed in Ukraine
43.article_body: After 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war with Russia, his hostel mate Sridharan Gopalakrishnan revealed Naveen had gone to buy food. "He was standing in  queue at a grocery shop when Russian army fired at people. We have no information about his body," he added. Naveen's phone was recovered by a Ukrainian woman.

44.title: I need to go back & review the situation: FM on LIC IPO amid Russia-Ukraine war
44.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while speaking on LIC IPO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, told The Hindu BusinessLine, "Now there's a full-scale war. Therefore, I need to go back and review the situation." Sitharaman also said, "Ideally, I'd like to go ahead with it, because it is something we have planned for some time purely based on Indian considerations."

45.title: PM reviews Ukraine's situation daily to bring Indians back: Singh
45.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi "reviews the situation [in Ukraine] every day to bring our Indian citizens back". He added that people are facing difficulty as no airport or airstrip is left in Ukraine. "Still, we're talking to Ukrainian govt, neighbouring countries' govts to bring our citizens back," Singh added.

46.title: The label of a TV actor hurts actors working in TV shows: Urvashi
46.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said the categorisation of actors working in TV shows as TV actors hurts them, adding that it is an "awful" discrimination. "Most people taking the call of casting actors for OTT are from the TV background, but are hesitant to cast actors from TV saying we are too exposed," stated Urvashi.

47.title: 22-year-old killed by 3 friends after fight over PUBG game in Thane
47.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Tuesday arrested a 19-year-old and detained two minors for killing their 22-year-old friend after a "fight over...PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) game", police said. The deceased, Sayeel Jadhav, was killed on Monday in Thane's Vartak Nagar after being stabbed with a sharp weapon. They used to drink (liquor), play online games and get into constant fights, locals claimed.

48.title: Shibani drops 'Mrs Akhtar' from bio days after wedding with Farhan
48.article_body: Actress-model Shibani Dandekar on Tuesday removed 'Mrs Akhtar' from her social media bio days after getting married to actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar. She had added 'Mrs Akhtar' to her bio on February 23. The couple got married on February 19 in a private ceremony at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's farmhouse in Khandala. Shibani has updated her username to Shibani Dandekar-Akhtar.

49.title: My heart really goes out to Ukraine: Lady Gaga at SAG Awards 2022
49.article_body: Singer-actor Lady Gaga spoke about the Russia-Ukraine conflict at SAG Awards 2022, saying, "My heart really goes out to Ukraine. I think tonight we should all sit in the gratitude of this." She also posted a picture on Instagram, writing, "I'm praying tonight for Ukraine and am sending smiles to all your hearts I pray will be whole soon."

50.title: Pune ZP organises meetings to promote property ownership among women
50.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has organised special gram sabha to mark International Women's Day this year and encourage property ownership among women. Gram panchayats in Pune district have been setting up camps to include women's names on property cards. "Property ownership is an important aspect of empowerment, [we're] working hard to facilitate [it]," Ayush Prasad, CEO of Pune ZP said.

51.title: Suspect wanted for Pak journalist's murder killed in police encounter
51.article_body: The prime suspect in the murder of Pakistani journalist Athar Mateen was killed in a police encounter in Qambar Shahdadkot on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the police conducted a raid based on a tip-off. The suspect reportedly opened fire at the police party and was subsequently killed in retaliation. Notably, two other suspects have been arrested.

52.title: Indians waive tricolour, chant Vande Mataram on return from Ukraine
52.article_body: Another batch of Indian nationals that returned from Ukraine on Tuesday chanted slogans of 'Vande Mataram' and waived the tricolour on their return at the Delhi airport. They were welcomed by Union Power Minister RK Singh at the airport. Pictures show the minister interacting with the evacuees and giving them flowers.

53.title: IPL important but you can't cherry pick when to play for Aus: Hayden
53.article_body: Reacting to players like Pat Cummins opting out of the white-ball leg of Australia's tour of Pakistan, Matthew Hayden termed the IPL as important but said players can't "cherry pick" when to play for Australia. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26. "Cricket Australia is being led around by...players. You shouldn't be paid for work you don't do," added Hayden.

54.title: Egyptian King Tut's dagger was made of material from outer space: Experts
54.article_body: A dagger buried with Egypt's teenage King Tutankhamun was made with materials that may have come from outer space, experts have said. The dagger that was first found in 1925 was crafted from iron that may have been brought to Earth by a meteorite, said a recent study published in Meteoritics and Planetary Science journal.

55.title: Manmohan Desai would drive past house, wait for her 'darshan': Nanda's brother
55.article_body: Late actress Nanda's brother Jayprakash Winayak said that late filmmaker Manmohan Desai used to "drive past [her] bungalow hoping to catch a glimpse" of the actress. "He'd even park his car outside waiting for her 'darshan'...There was...Holy Cross opposite Didi's bungalow in Bandra...Manji made it a point to shoot there for films, hoping to get sight of her," he added.

56.title: At least 10 killed in latest rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv: Official
56.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured in rocket strikes by Russian forces on Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv on Tuesday, Ukraine's Interior Ministry adviser Anton Herashchenko said. "The rubble is being cleared and there will be even more victims and wounded," he added. Earlier, an Indian student from Karnataka was killed in shelling in Kharkiv.

57.title: Going to be a big challenge to pick between Shreyas, Suryakumar: Rohit
57.article_body: Talking about picking between Shreyas Iyer and Suryakumar Yadav, Rohit Sharma termed it as a "big" challenge. Shreyas was the top run-getter in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. Suryakumar was India's highest run-scorer in the T20I series against West Indies with 107 runs at a strike rate of 194.54.

58.title: Parents' consent not mandatory for offline exams for Classes 10, 12 in Delhi
58.article_body: The Delhi government on Monday notified that the consent of parents for attending offline classes and giving offline exams is not mandatory for students of Classes 10 and 12. It added schools may deploy transportation facilities for students while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. The hybrid mode for studies for Classes up to 9 and Class 11 will continue till March 31.

59.title: Prabhas and Saif-starrer 'Adipurush' to release on Jan 12, 2023
59.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Prabhas announced the new release date of his film 'Adipurush'. The film, which was slated to release on August 11, will now release on January 12, 2023. Earlier, actor Aamir Khan had thanked the makers of 'Adipurush' for postponing their release date as his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will be releasing on August 11.

60.title: We can't stand back anymore: Benedict on Russia-Ukraine conflict
60.article_body: After being honoured at the Hollywood Walk of Fame, actor Benedict Cumberbatch expressed his support for the people of Ukraine, after Russia invaded the country. Benedict added he also supports the people in Russia who are opposing "kleptocracy and the idiocy of their rulers"."We can't stand back anymore...We need to act, and there are things you can do," he stated.

61.title: SP has hit two centuries in 5 phases of UP elections: Akhilesh
61.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said his party has already hit two centuries in the first five phases of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. "Our announcement to give 300 units free electricity has left the BJP clueless," Akhilesh said at a rally. "People...are fed up with BJP's lies," he added.

62.title: It will be unique if Bumrah becomes Team India captain: Irfan Pathan
62.article_body: Irfan Pathan said it will be "unique" if Jasprit Bumrah becomes Team India captain in the future, as not too many Indian bowlers have been seen in the role of a captain. "Bumrah's journey has been outstanding. He has become India's number one bowler because he plays in all the formats and bowls at difficult stages," added Irfan.

63.title: Record 21 lakh diyas to be lit up in MP's Ujjain on Mahashivratri
63.article_body: Around 21 lakh diyas will be lit up in MP's Ujjain, including 13 lakh diyas on the banks of Kshipra river, as part of Mahashivratri celebrations on Tuesday. "As many as 14,000 volunteers are participating," Ujjain Municipal Commissioner said. With this, the state government is trying to set a record of lighting the highest number of diyas, he added.

64.title: SIT report on border violence in Mon district ready: Nagaland minister
64.article_body: Nagaland minister V Kashiho Sangtam said the Special Investigation Team (SIT) has completed the investigation and is ready with its report on the border violence that took place in Mon district last year. However, it is yet to receive the forensic laboratory report, Sangtam told ANI. As many as 14 civilians were killed in the violence last year.

65.title: Thoughts go out to all suffering from needless war: Louis on cancelling show
65.article_body: Amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine crisis, singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson cancelled his tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv. "I have to sadly announce that my tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv are cancelled until further notice," he wrote, adding, "Safety of my fans is priority, my thoughts go out to the people of Ukraine and all those suffering from this needless war."

66.title: Prospects for diplomatic resolution to Ukraine crisis slim: UK
66.article_body: Britain's Deputy PM Dominic Raab on Tuesday said the prospects of a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis are "slim" at the moment. However, "we must always make sure that we keep the door to a diplomatic resolution open without, I think, instilling too many hopes in it", he added. Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

67.title: It is stupid to think about the possibility of being at war: Conte
67.article_body: Reacting to Vladimir Putin's declaration of war against Ukraine, Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said even "thinking" about the possibility of being at "war" is stupid. "We are in 2022 and to talk about the possibility of being at war is incredible. We need peace, not people dying. The war...is not an answer to anything," stated the former Chelsea manager.

68.title: A tremendous thinker of the game: Labuschagne on Ashwin
68.article_body: Calling Ravichandran Ashwin a "tremendous thinker of the game", Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said not all bowlers are like the India off-spinner. "He [Ashwin] is always thinking about how he can get you out. About what you are doing. And so what he's doing to counter that?" he added. The 35-year-old dismissed Labuschagne twice in Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2020-21 in Australia.

69.title: Space technology important tool for a nation: ISRO Chairman
69.article_body: ISRO Chairman, Dr S Somanath, said space technology is an important tool that a nation needs for good command on the scientific front. "Space technology and rocket science have enabled human beings to send instruments into space lasting for several years," Somanath said. He was speaking at the National Science Day celebrations organised by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Bengaluru.

70.title: Heat waves in Indo-Gangetic plains likely to be lower than normal: IMD
70.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted that the number of heat waves in the Indo-Gangetic plains is likely to be lower than normal during March to May period. As per IMD, a "heat wave" is declared for the plains when the maximum temperature is more than 40°C. Gujarat, Sindh, Punjab, Bihar, Bengal and Assam region come under the Indo-Gangetic plains.

71.title: It's incredibly odd walking in fashion shows amid Ukraine crisis: Bella Hadid
71.article_body: Model Bella Hadid came out in support of her colleague Mica Argañaraz, who vowed to donate part of her fashion week earnings to Ukrainian organisations. Sharing her post, Bella wrote, "It's incredibly odd to be walking in fashion shows...especially during a time like this. I compel...people of our industry to...have open conversations about the hell that's happening next door."

72.title: I thought I was going to be a comedy skit blogger: Jamie Dornan
72.article_body: Actor Jamie Dornan, who played the male lead role of 'Christian Grey' in the 'Fifty Shades' film franchise, said he thought he would be a comedy skit blogger at one point. "Then I did [TV series] 'The Fall' where I play a serial killer. I used to always want to do comedy and then I just didn't," added Dornan.

73.title: 36 Kerala students stranded in Ukraine evacuated, says state govt
73.article_body: As many as 36 students hailing from Kerala, arrived from Ukraine on Monday evening, the state government said. "Kerala students update: Among 36 students arrived from Ukraine to Delhi yesterday (Monday) evening, 25 left for Kochi...11 left for Trivandrum," the Kerala government tweeted on Tuesday. These students were brought back under 'Operation Ganga'.

74.title: Sea-level rise damage in Mumbai could be $162 bn/yr by 2050: IPCC
74.article_body: The IPCC's latest report has warned that damage from sea-level rise in Mumbai alone could be up to $162 billion a year by 2050. Around 35 million people in India could face annual coastal flooding. It added that heat and humidity will globally create conditions beyond human tolerance if emissions are not rapidly eliminated, and India will experience those conditions.

75.title: Jaishankar briefs Prez Ram Nath Kovind on evacuations from Ukraine
75.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday said that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday briefed President Ram Nath Kovind about the ongoing evacuation of Indian nationals from Ukraine which is under attack from Russia. "Later the President called PM Narendra Modi and lauded the government's efforts," it added. The Centre launched 'Operation Ganga' to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

76.title: Key maker allegedly steals jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from Gurugram house
76.article_body: A key maker allegedly stole jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from the house of a retired central government employee in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The incident reportedly occurred when the victim had called the key maker to get an almirah lock repaired at his house. Meanwhile, police have started an investigation into the matter and trying to arrest the accused.

77.title: He was so proud of it: 'Pavitra Rishta' director on Sushant's 'Sonchiriya'
77.article_body: 'Pavitra Rishta' director Kushal Zaveri took to Instagram to share a post about Sushant Singh Rajput starrer 'Sonchiriya' completing three years. "3rd anniversary of #sonchiriya...He was so proud of this film...Please watch it if you haven't," Kushal wrote. Fans took to comment section to show love for film. "Loved this film," one user wrote. "Forever in my heart," wrote another.

78.title: 5 booked for clicking pictures inside polling booth in UP
78.article_body: UP police registered an FIR against five persons for taking pictures and videos inside a polling booth in Sultanpur. The police identified the accused after they posted videos of them casting votes on social media. According to Sultanpur SP Vipin Mishra, they secretly carried their phones inside the booth, which is against the rules.

79.title: 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh seized in Bengaluru, two arrested
79.article_body: The police have arrested two drug peddlers and recovered over 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh from their possession in Bengaluru. The accused have been identified as Prakash (29) and Sundarapandi (25), both residents of Hosur in Tamil Nadu. The accused had purchased the contraband from Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, and were planning to sell it in Bengaluru.

80.title: BMRCL seeks transfer of land ownership to build Kempapura station
80.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation (BMRCL) has sought the transfer of ownership of land falling under the Nagawara lake from the state government. The land will be used to build the airport line's Kempapura cross station. "Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority has issued an NOC to BMRCL to use the land," said BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez.

81.title: Man threatens wife with her obscene pictures in Tamil Nadu, arrested
81.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested in Tamil Nadu after he threatened his 27-year-old wife with her obscene pictures. He also demanded a new house as dowry. The couple had got married in October 2020. The man had reportedly told the woman that she had pimples on her face and he does not wish to spend his life with her.

82.title: Man killed by brother and nephew for selling bull in Nagpur
82.article_body: A 32-year-old man was allegedly killed by his elder brother and nephew for selling a bull without informing them in Bhagebori village of Maharashtra's Nagpur district. The two accused, Hansraj Dekate, 58, and his son Pranay, 24, attacked the victim with a rod and then smashed his head with a stone, police said. They were arrested under charges of murder.

83.title: Minister Hardeep Puri en route to Budapest to aid evacuation of Indians
83.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri is en route to Budapest in Hungary on an Indigo flight to aid the evacuation of Indian citizens stranded in war-hit Ukraine. "All set to bring back our young students back home safely," Puri tweeted. "En route to Budapest with a refuelling stop in Istanbul with the ever efficient 6E boys and girls," he added.

84.title: Court officer stabs judicial magistrate over repeated transfers in TN
84.article_body: An office assistant of court in Tamil Nadu's Salem, Prakash, allegedly stabbed Judicial Magistrate IV M Ponpandi on Tuesday after an argument over his repeated transfers. "Around 10:30 am, Prakash allegedly took out a pen-like sharp object he was hiding...and attacked the judicial magistrate," police said. Ponpandi suffered injuries on the chest and shoulder. Prakash has been arrested.

85.title: I consider actor Raza Murad as my lucky mascot: Sanjay Leela Bhansali
85.article_body: Director Sanjay Leela Bhansali termed actor Raza Murad as his "lucky mascot", adding that Murad had to be a part of his film and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' at any cost. "He has been in my last three films and they were...successes. There was no full-fledged role...this time, so I...asked him to be part of a party sequence," stated Bhansali.

86.title: Europe's joint Mars mission with Russia postponed due to war: ESA
86.article_body: The ExoMars 2022 rover, a joint mission between the European and Russian space agency that was expected to launch this year is now "very unlikely" to take place due to sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine. "We are fully implementing sanctions imposed on Russia by our Member States," the European Space Agency said in a statement.

87.title: Today LPG, tomorrow petrol & diesel: Rahul Gandhi criticises LPG price hike
87.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the hike in the price of LPG cylinders. "By increasing the prices of LPG, PM Modi-led government made it clear that it is not concerned about the suffering of common people. Today LPG, tomorrow petrol and diesel," Gandhi tweeted. The price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders has increased by ₹105 in Delhi.

88.title: 25-yr-old woman found hanging at marital home in UP, probe underway
88.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was found hanging at her marital home in the Banda district of Uttar Pradesh, reports said. According to reports, the husband of the deceased, Amit Gupta, found the house locked from inside on Monday and informed the police when it was not opened despite repeated knocks. Police said a case of suicide has been registered.

89.title: Gurugram likely to receive light rainfall on Thursday: IMD
89.article_body: Gurugram is likely to receive light rain and thundershowers on Thursday, because of the impact of a western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. According to IMD's forecast, Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to drop by one or two degrees, while the minimum temperature is likely to rise by at least three degrees.

90.title: Bobby reacts to viral memes featuring him, says 'Keep hilarious stuff coming'
90.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol reacted to viral memes featuring him in a new video, as part of his film Love Hostel's promotions. The video begins with a still of Bobby, in which he seems to be using an airpod. Reacting to it, Bobby said, "I've always been ahead of time." Alongside the video, Bobby wrote, "Keep such hilarious stuff coming."

91.title: BSP candidates decided in Amit Shah's room: SBSP's Rajbhar
91.article_body: Alleging BSP supremo Mayawati of helping BJP win in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar said, the BSP candidates are being finalised in Amit Shah's room. Earlier, Amit Shah had said that BSP is still relevant and will get Jatav and Muslim votes. The SBSP is contesting in 18 Assembly seats in alliance with the SP.

92.title: Equation we had with journalists was better than what boys have today: Shastri
92.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the equation of cricketers with journalists has changed since the time he used to play. "The equation we had with the journalists was far far better than the equation you see with the boys today," he stated. Recently, wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha received threatening WhatsApp messages from a journalist.

93.title: Amazon India elevates Amit Agarwal to head emerging markets
93.article_body: Amazon India's country head Amit Agarwal has been appointed as the Senior Vice President India and Emerging Markets at Amazon. Manish Tiwary, vice-president of the consumer business, will be the country manager for consumer business in India. Tiwary will also be responsible for Amazon Business, its business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce platform which sells goods to small and medium enterprises.

94.title: Police arrest 2 gangsters after cross-firing in Outer Delhi's Alipur
94.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two gangsters, aged 31 and 22, after 22 rounds of bullets were fired by both parties in Outer Delhi's Alipur. A woman sub-inspector received two bullets on her bullet-proof jacket, police said. "The gangsters were planning to kill a Delhi police official and Tillu Tajpuria, a rival gangster who is in jail," police added.

95.title: Dancer drugged, raped by contractor and his 10 aides in UP
95.article_body: A professional dancer in Uttar Pradesh's Bithoor was allegedly drugged and gang-raped by a contractor and his ten aides. The woman claimed the accused invited her to perform at a farmhouse and offered her cold drink laced with sedatives. After drinking it she became unconscious and was raped by him and his aides who also filmed the act, she alleged.

96.title: BBMP bans sale of meat across Bengaluru on Maha Shivaratri
96.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has ordered a complete ban on the sale of meat across Bengaluru on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. The BBMP's animal advisory division had issued a circular to this effect on February 22. The circular also extends to the ban of animal slaughter in the city.

97.title: Man's partially burnt body found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area
97.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 29-year-old man was found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area on Monday, police said. The deceased, identified as Abdul Salam Munawar Ali Sayyed, succumbed to a head injury and was burnt by the accused likely to destroy evidence, the post-mortem report suggested. The body was first spotted by a resident, who then informed the police.

98.title: Domestic helps drug house owner's daughter in Gurugram, steal jewellery
98.article_body: Three house helps, including two maids and a former cook, allegedly drugged the house owner's daughter and stole jewellery and other valuables worth ₹15 lakh in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The girl's parents had reportedly gone to Mumbai when the incident occurred. Police said the crime seems to be well planned, adding that they're trying to trace the accused.

99.title: Author Stephen King shares rare pic in support of Ukraine, country responds
99.article_body: American author Stephen King shared a photo of himself wearing a t-shirt that said 'I stand with Ukraine' and wrote, "I don't usually post pictures of myself, but today is an exception." Meanwhile, Ukraine responded, "We'll prevail over those langoliers for you, sir." King had also tweeted, "For the first time in a long and infamous career, Putin looks stupid."

100.title: K'taka CM speaks with father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
100.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Tuesday spoke with the father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student who was killed in shelling in Ukraine. Naveen was a resident of the Haveri district. "All efforts will be made to bring back Naveen's body to India," his office said, adding that this matter is being negotiated with foreign ministry officials.

101.title: Newly wed Indo-Ukrainian couple who escaped war by 1 day host reception in Hyd
101.article_body: Hyderabad resident Prateek who returned from Ukraine along with his newly wed Ukrainian wife Lyubov a day before Russian invasion of Ukraine last week hosted his wedding reception in Hyderabad. Pictures of their wedding ceremony are being widely shared online. Several Indians are being evacuated from Ukraine through border nations after the Ukrainian airspace was closed amid war.

102.title: Tigress found dead in Kaziranga National Park in Assam; poisoning suspected
102.article_body: Forest authorities in Assam's Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve have found the carcass of a tigress. "The carcass of the tigress was found near the carcass of a cow. Initial investigations reveal the tigress could've died after consuming the meat of the cow, which could've been poisoned," Kaziranga DFO said. A case of poaching by poisoning has been registered.

103.title: CBFC removes words like f*cking, assh*les at 12 places in 'The Batman'
103.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has muted cuss words like 'f*cking', 'assh*les' and 'son of a b*tch' at 12 places from the dialogues of upcoming film 'The Batman'. These muted cuss words have also been removed from the film's subtitles. The Robert Pattinson-starrer has been passed by the CBFC with a U/A certificate after the modifications.

104.title: Kim Kardashian lookalike posts selfie with Kanye, sparks dating rumours
104.article_body: Instagram model Chaney Jones took to Instagram Stories to share a selfie with rapper Kanye West sparking dating rumours. The model has gained popularity for being a lookalike of Kanye's former wife television personality Kim Kardashian. Kim filed for divorce last year in February and is currently dating Pete Davidson. Kanye and Chaney were spotted together in Miami last week.

105.title: Poland PM to discuss Ukraine's EU candidacy with EU chief: Official
105.article_body: Poland's PM Mateusz Morawiecki will discuss support for Ukraine joining European Union (EU) with European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen in Brussels, a Polish government spokesperson said. Poland and Lithuania had previously endorsed Ukraine's membership to bloc citing "security challenges". On Monday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application for Ukraine to join the EU.

106.title: Latest rankings for women's ODI batters out, Mandhana rises to 8th spot
106.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Women ODI batters, with India captain Mithali Raj holding onto her second spot and Smriti Mandhana rising four spots to be ranked eighth. Batter Harmanpreet Kaur gained three spots to be ranked 20th while Deepti Sharma dropped two spots to the 21st position. New Zealand's Amy Satterthwaite slipped to the seventh position.

107.title: DTCP issues notices over illegal structures along Sohna-Gurugram road
107.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) on Monday issued notices to 15 people for illegally constructing shops and other structures along Sohna-Gurugram Highway, officials said. "The owners have been asked to reply to the matter within the next 15 days," a senior official said. "It's important that illegal constructions...are stopped...in the initial stage itself," the official added.

108.title: Rajkot Police Commissioner transferred amid corruption allegations
108.article_body: Rajkot Police Commissioner Manoj Agrawal was on Monday transferred and appointed as the principal of the State Reserve Police Training Centre in Junagadh. On February 2, Rajkot South MLA Govind Patel, had written to Gujarat Minister of State for Home, Harsh Sanghavi, alleging that Agrawal was demanding a cut of 15% from the money restored to victims of financial fraud.

109.title: Share info on locals stranded in Ukraine: GB Nagar admin to residents
109.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar administration on Monday has urged residents to inform it of locals who are stranded in Ukraine amid a Russian invasion. The information has been sought as part of the Centre's Operation Ganga, an initiative to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine, the administration said. "The information can be provided at tehsil-level," it added.

110.title: Russian billionaires lose combined $83 billion wealth in 2 months
110.article_body: The combined wealth of Russia's 22 richest individuals has plunged by $83 billion since January 2022, as per Bloomberg. The wipeout comes amid extreme market declines following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov has lost the most among Russian billionaires with his net worth declining by $13 billion. Meanwhile, Gennady Timchenko has lost almost half of his wealth.

111.title: Sanctions will cause collapse of Russian economy: France
111.article_body: France said sanctions against Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine will cause the Russian economy to collapse. "The economic and financial balance of power is...in favour of...European Union which is in the process of discovering its own economic power," Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire added. This comes a day after EU and France said they'd impose new sanctions on Russia.

112.title: Weibo removes 4,000 posts ridiculing war, offending Ukrainian women
112.article_body: China's social media platform Weibo has removed over 4,000 posts that "ridiculed war" and mocked the situation in Ukraine. The posts also included inappropriate and vulgar remarks related to Ukrainian women. Earlier, jokes about taking in Ukrainian women reportedly began circulating, with the hashtag "willing to shelter 18 to 24-year-old Ukrainian girls" trending on Weibo before it was censored.

113.title: Huge honour to take over this spot: Medvedev on becoming world no. 1
113.article_body: US Open champion Daniil Medvedev said it's a "huge honour" for him to become the new world number one. The Russian is first player outside 'Big Four' of Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Andy Murray to hold top spot. "I'm sure everyone can understand it comes with mixed emotions that it happens this week [Russia-Ukraine conflict]," he added.

114.title: 1.80 lakh devotees take holy dip in Ganga in Prayagraj on Shivratri
114.article_body: Over 1.80 lakh devotees took a holy dip in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj till Tuesday afternoon on Mahashivratri. The Prayagraj administration has arranged six ghats for devotees to take bath. Also, around 650 toilets have been arranged in the 'Magh mela' area, an official said, adding that three first aid centres and a hospital are also operational.

115.title: Opening with Shikhar Dhawan would be fantastic: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal
115.article_body: PBKS' newly-appointed captain Mayank Agarwal has said he's excited to open their batting along with Shikhar Dhawan. "There are a lot of players in the Punjab team I am really excited about...Opening with Shikhar would be fantastic...We have picked all-rounder Raj Bawa [also]...I am looking forward to playing with him," he added. PBKS bought Dhawan for ₹8.25 crore.

116.title: PMC to set up e-vehicle charging stations at its premises
116.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to set up e-vehicle charging systems at various PMC-owned premises. "Many [Pune] residents are procuring e-vehicles. To facilitate them and promote these vehicles, the PMC has approved erecting charging stations at its main building and all the regional ward offices," Standing Committee Chairperson Hemant Rasane said.

117.title: 2 hand grenades found in locked home in Gurugram, neutralised: Police
117.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran confirmed on Tuesday that two hand grenades and used cartridges were found in a locked and vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31. The police had received a tip-off around 9:45 am. "We are yet to find out where these grenades were transported from and how they ended up in the house," police said.

118.title: Video shows Ukrainian children singing national anthem while hiding in bomb shelter
118.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine has shared a video where children could be seen singing the national anthem while hiding in a bomb shelter. The Ukrainian anthem originates from a 19th-century Ukrainian poem titled 'Ukraine Is Not Dead Yet'. Several such videos of citizens singing the anthem amid the Russian invasion have also surfaced on social media.

119.title: Reality shows other than Smart Jodi are couple breakers: Rahul Mahajan
119.article_body: TV personality Rahul Mahajan said that reality shows barring the new reality show Smart Jodi are "couple breakers", adding that he and his wife Natalya Ilina Mahajan "really like" actress Ankita Lokhande and her husband Vicky Jain. "There could be fights between them or can cause other problems too. You have to be real," stated Rahul.

120.title: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions over Ukraine invasion
120.article_body: Global payment card majors Visa and Mastercard have blocked many of Russia's financial institutions from their network in compliance with the sanctions imposed by the US government over Ukraine invasion. "We will continue to work with regulators in the days ahead," said Mastercard. Both companies also promised to donate $2 million each for humanitarian aid in Ukraine.

121.title: Won't allow state Budget session until Malik resigns: Maha BJP
121.article_body: The Maharashtra BJP said that it will not allow the state Budget session to be held until NCP's Nawab Malik resigns from the cabinet. "The BJP has asked the MVA government to seek Malik's resignation for his alleged links and land deals with underworld don Dawood Ibrahim and the 1993 serial bomb blast convicts," BJP Maharashtra chief Chandrakant Patil said.

122.title: Volopay, founded by 2 Indians, raises $29 mn from Winklevoss twins, others
122.article_body: Singapore-based fintech startup Volopay has raised $29 million in Series A, a mix of equity and debt, from Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss' venture capital firm Winklevoss Capital and JAM Fund, among others. The round also saw participation from Pine Labs CEO Amrish Rau and Jupiter CEO Jitendra Gupta. Volopay was founded by two Indians, Rajesh Raikwar and Rajith Shaji.

123.title: 28-year-old woman, 6-year-old daughter found dead in a well in Pune
123.article_body: A 28-year-old woman and her six-year-old daughter, who had gone missing since February 26 in Pune, were found in a well in Ganegaon Khalsa village, police said. The woman left with her daughter on Saturday, saying she was taking her to the coaching class, police added. The husband filed a missing report when the two didn't return home till late.

124.title: Future Retail gets NCLT nod to convene meetings to approve RIL deal
124.article_body: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has allowed Future Retail to convene meetings of its shareholders and creditors to seek their approval for the sale of its retail assets to Reliance Retail. The companies had announced the ₹24,713 crore deal in 2020. Notably, Reliance has started taking over the operations of Future Retail stores, as per reports last week.

125.title: Indian student who died in shelling in Ukraine was 21 years old, hailed from Karnataka
125.article_body: The Indian student who lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv has been identified as 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar. He was a fourth year MBBS student at Kharkiv National Medical University and hailed from Haveri district in Karnataka. As per reports, he was standing in a queue at a supermarket in Kharkiv when Russian shelling happened.

126.title: Hacker group Anonymous renames Putin's $100 million yacht as 'FCKPTN'
126.article_body: The world's largest hacker collective Anonymous said it has changed the name of Russian President Vladimir Putin's $100 million luxury yacht from 'Graceful' to 'FCKPTN', amid Ukraine's invasion. The group vandalised maritime tracking data and changed the yacht's location information to make it appear that it crashed into Ukraine's Snake Island. The hackers then renamed its destination to 'hell'.

127.title: If I start speaking, Sequoia won't be able to invest in India: BharatPe's Ashneer
127.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as MD, in an interview, criticised board chairman Rajnish Kumar, CEO Suhail Sameer and other independent directors and investors, saying, "I have so much dirt on them." "Tomorrow if I start speaking, Sequoia (Capital) will not be able to make a single investment in India. You will have ED, CBI behind them," he claimed.

128.title: Priyanka, Nick perform first Maha Shivratri puja after becoming parents
128.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra and her husband, Nick Jonas on Tuesday celebrated their first Maha Shivratri after becoming parents. Taking to Instagram Stories, Priyanka shared pictures as they performed pooja at their home in Los Angeles. In the picture, Priyanka wore a pink outfit. Sharing the post, Priyanka wrote in Hindi, "Maha Shivratri ki hardik shubhkamnaye. (Best wishes on Maha Shivratri)."

129.title: Manipur to get new AIIMS, announces PM Modi in virtual address
129.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced construction of a new AIIMS in Manipur. "We are planning to build an AIIMS in Manipur. This is the time of Atmanirbhar Bharat," said Modi addressing a virtual rally ahead of the second phase of assembly polls in the state. It would be the 24th AIIMS to come up in the country.

130.title: MP govt to arrange for food, stay of students returning from Ukraine
130.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has directed officials to make arrangements for accommodation, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine. Over 180 students stuck in Ukraine have contacted a helpline set up by the Madhya Pradesh CM, an official said. As many as 29 people from the state have returned from Ukraine.

131.title: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after 3.3% hike, fifth hike in 2022
131.article_body: Prices of Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF), touched their all-time high after a 3.22% rise due to rising crude oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹3,010.87/kilolitre to ₹93,530.66/kl in Delhi. This is the fifth time that prices of ATF, which makes up for almost 40% of an airline's running cost, have been hiked in 2022.

132.title: Taiwan sends medical supplies to Ukraine amid Russian invasion
132.article_body: Taiwan has sent 27 tonnes of medical supplies to Ukraine, its government announced on Tuesday, stating that it's extending a helping hand as member of "democratic camp" in international community. These supplies were sent to Germany and will be delivered to Ukraine from there. Additionally, Taiwan will also block certain Russian banks from SWIFT payment system, Premier Su Tseng-chang said.

133.title: Not sure what it means, we're the dictionary: Dictionary.com on US politician's tweet
133.article_body: Dictionary.com trolled US lawmaker Clay Higgins over his tweet on the Russia-Ukraine war by responding, "We're not sure what this tweet is supposed to mean, and we're literally the dictionary." Higgins had called out "millennial leftists who never lived one day under nuclear threat" to reflect upon their "woke sky". Musician Jonathan Mann turned Higgins' tweet into a song.

134.title: Cameras were switched off by investors during board meeting: BharatPe's Ashneer
134.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as BharatPe's MD and board director, claimed cameras were switched off by the investors during a board meeting. He said, "Because, at that particular time, that investor is giving WhatsApp instructions to everyone in the meeting on how to vote." Grover added, "I'll take this up to the Minister of Corporate Affairs."

135.title: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions after sanctions
135.article_body: Visa and Mastercard have blocked multiple Russian financial institutions, including the Russian central bank, from their network after the US imposed sanctions over Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We'll continue to work with regulators...to abide fully by our compliance obligations as they evolve," Mastercard said. Visa and Mastercard also promised to contribute $2 million each for humanitarian aid.

136.title: UP man strangles wife with saree for chatting on phone for long hours
136.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his wife with a saree and later surrendered at the local police station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. The man told police that he killed his wife as he was upset over her prolonged use of mobile phone. "His wife used to chat on the mobile phone with someone for long hours," a senior police officer said.

137.title: Ukraine is victim of crises created by US: Iran Supreme Leader
137.article_body: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei said Ukraine is a "victim of the crises concocted by the US". "There are two lessons to be learnt here. States which depend on the support of...US, Western powers need to know they cannot trust such countries. It's people that matter; if Ukrainians supported their government, the situation would've been different from...current crisis," he added.

138.title: Man stabs brother to death for fighting with his friend in Mumbai, held
138.article_body: A 30-year-old man, Ashok, stabbed his brother Akash to death in Mumbai after Akash fought with Ashok's friend. The incident took place in Lal Baug's Chivda Galli. Kalachowki Police have arrested Ashok in the case. A case has also been registered against him under Section 302 (Punishment for murder) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

139.title: I sleep for 3 hours some days, it's not easy at all: Nishant on TV career
139.article_body: Television actor Nishant Malkhani, while talking about his work, said that "it is not easy at all". "It is very tough and hectic...I sleep for three hours at night on some days...It is physically tiring but very satisfying emotionally. As an actor, you want to be busy...dabble with different kinds of roles...No one likes to sit at home," he added.

140.title: GST revenues rise 18% in Feb to cross ₹1.3 lakh cr mark for 5th time
140.article_body: Gross revenue collection from GST surged 18% YoY to ₹1,33,026 crore in February 2022, government data showed. This is the fifth time GST collection crossed the ₹1.3 lakh crore mark. Revenues collected in February 2022 are 26% higher than those collected in February 2020. Of the total revenue, central GST is ₹24,435 crore and state GST is ₹30,779 crore.

141.title: Malik approaches Bombay HC seeking quashing of money laundering case
141.article_body: Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Nawab Malik has approached Bombay High Court seeking to quash a money laundering case registered by Enforcement Directorate against him. He said his arrest was illegal and asked the court to release him immediately. He was arrested in connection to an alleged money laundering case linked to underworld don Dawood Ibrahim and his aides.

142.title: YouTube blocks Russian state-run media Sputnik & RT across Europe
142.article_body: Google on Tuesday announced that it is blocking the YouTube channels connected to Russian state-run media companies RT and Sputnik across Europe with immediate effect due to the ongoing war in Ukraine. "It'll take time for our systems to fully ramp up. Our teams continue to monitor the situation around the clock to take swift action," the tech giant said.

143.title: B'luru traffic to be affected amid Mekedatu rally; police issues advisory
143.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has issued an advisory for commuters as the traffic in the city is expected to be affected till March 3 amid the Congress' Mekedatu rally. Traffic from the Tavarekere junction to BTM Layout 1st stage has been diverted from Dairy Circle to Jayadeva junction. People going from Mysuru-Bengaluru have been advised to go through the NICE Bridge.

144.title: Foundation stones laid for 26 NH projects worth ₹12,795 cr in K'taka
144.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Monday laid the foundation stones for 26 National Highway projects spread across 925 kilometres worth ₹12,795 crore in Karnataka's Hubballi. "They will provide connectivity to heritage monuments in Karnataka which will boost the tourism sector and create sustainable employment opportunities in the state," Gadkari tweeted.

145.title: Pic shows blood-stained mother clutching child's scarf as medics fail to save her in Ukraine
145.article_body: A picture showing a blood-stained mother crying while clutching her daughter's scarf as paramedics fail to save her in Ukraine is being widely shared online. The girl was fatally wounded in the Russian airstrike, according to reports. The picture shows paramedics performing CPR on the girl as her mother stood outside.

146.title: Asked him for a few minutes, we ended up talking for 4 hours: Jemimah on Kohli
146.article_body: India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues narrated how she and fellow batter Smriti Mandhana met Virat Kohli at a hotel cafe in New Zealand. "We had asked him for just a few minutes but we ended up speaking for four hours. We spoke half an hour about batting but after that, it was just normal things," she added.

147.title: Shouldn't be much of an issue: Gavaskar on Rohit's 1st Test as skipper
147.article_body: Ex-India skipper Sunil Gavaskar said Rohit Sharma captaining Team India for the first time in a Test against Sri Lanka shouldn't be an issue because of his experience of captaining various teams. "Yes, this is...longer format, so the tactics...the approach will be different. But he has got the experience," he added. First India-Sri Lanka Test will begin on March 4.

148.title: Indian student killed in shelling in war in Ukraine
148.article_body: An Indian student has lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the Centre confirmed on Tuesday. Some reports quoted his friends as saying that they had left for the train station to leave for Ukrainian city of Lviv to reach the western border. This comes as Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked Indians to leave Kyiv urgently amid Russian invasion.

149.title: Several injured in cylinder blast at maternity hospital in J&K's Anantnag
149.article_body: Several people were injured in a cylinder blast at Maternity and Child Care Hospital (MCCH) in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Tuesday. According to a hospital official, the explosion took place due to a leakage in a heating gas cylinder at the ticket counter. He added that the injured persons have been shifted to Anantnag's Government Medical College for treatment.

150.title: Congress didn't work for Manipur's development, encouraged separatism: PM
150.article_body: Congress party did not work for the development of Manipur and encouraged separatism, PM Narendra Modi said. "The people of Manipur have to be aware of this. BJP works for the development of the Northeast, especially Manipur," PM Modi added. "This is destroying their plans of divide and rule," PM Modi stated.

151.title: Nadal's will unquestionably be the GOAT if he wins French Open 2022: Kyrgios
151.article_body: Nick Kyrgios said Rafael Nadal will unquestionably the "GOAT (Greatest of All Time)" if he wins French Open 2022, adding that Daniil Medvedev is the best player currently despite Nadal winning the Australian Open 2022 final. Medvedev and Nadal competed in the final, with a triumph resulting in the Spaniard winning a record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title.

152.title: Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieves ridership of 70 cr commuters in 7 years
152.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieved a ridership of 70 crore commuters within seven years and two months of operational days, said officials. This achievement has been the outcome of "world-class service" and "flawless operational excellence", said an official. Inaugurated in 2014, Metro Line 1 added one million commuters from 20th October 2019 to 28th February 2022.

153.title: Delhi zoo reopens after 2 months, all 4,000 tickets sold overnight
153.article_body: Delhi zoo reopened for the public on Tuesday after remaining closed for nearly two months due to surge in COVID-19 cases. All 4,000 tickets were sold by 8:30 am after the link to book tickets was reactivated on Monday night. Only 4,000 people are allowed in the zoo from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 12:30 pm to 4:30 pm.

154.title: 2 men sexually assault 16-yr-old boy in Gurugram, booked
154.article_body: Two men have been booked for allegedly sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy working as a domestic help at their house in Gurugram Sector-56, police said. According to a senior police officer, the house owner first assaulted the boy in an inebriated condition. However, when the boy approached the owner's friend for help, the latter too sodomised him, the officer added.

155.title: Woman stitches gold beads worth ₹18 lakh in burqa, caught at Hyd airport
155.article_body: Customs officers at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport booked a woman passenger for smuggling 350.00 grams of gold worth ₹18.18 lakh. According to the officials, she had concealed the gold in the form of beads, coated with rhodium, that were stitched on burqas. Meanwhile, a case has been registered against the woman, who had arrived from Dubai on February 26.

156.title: 3.5 lakh Ukrainians have entered Poland since war began: Min
156.article_body: Polish Deputy Interior Minister Maciej Wasik said that 1,00,000 people have crossed the Polish-Ukrainian border in the last 24 hours. Around 3,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on Thursday, Wasik told public broadcaster Polskie Radio 1. According to the UN refugee agency, more than five lakh people have fled Ukraine since Thursday.

157.title: Visva-Bharati students hold protests, demand reopening of hostels
157.article_body: A section of students at West Bengal's Visva-Bharati University has been protesting at the Registrar's office since Monday demanding reopening of hostels, holding of exams online and postponing of board exams. According to a protesting student, physical classes had resumed on February 3, however, hostels remain closed. "Students are facing challenges in attending their classes," the student added.

158.title: Man kills younger brother over fight with friend in Mumbai
158.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly killing his younger brother in the Kalachowki area. "(The accused) Ashok...killed (his brother) Akash with a knife after the latter fought with the accused's friend," Mumbai Police said on Tuesday. Ashok has been booked under IPC Section 302, police added. The siblings are residents of GD Ambekar Marg.

159.title: Alcohol consumers who help expose smugglers may avoid jail in Bihar
159.article_body: Bihar government is planning to grant relief from jail to tipplers if they cooperate with authorities in identifying liquor smugglers. The move comes as part of the government's crackdown on liquor traders and to decongest the jails. "We need to stop overcrowding jails and give legal relief to those who cooperate with us in tracking liquor traders," said an official.

160.title: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurates 'Arogya Vanam' at Rashtrapati Bhavan
160.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday inaugurated 'Arogya Vanam' in presence of PM Narendra Modi, to publicise the importance of Ayurvedic plants and their benefits. Spread across 6.6 acres at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, the Arogya Vanam has been developed in the shape of a human sitting in Yoga Mudra. It consists of around 215 herbs used in Ayurveda.

161.title: Women don't get to play action-based roles, we don't get the budget: Huma
161.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she is very keen on doing action films. "I enjoy doing action-based films," she added. Huma said that women don't get many opportunities to play action-based roles. "We don't get such scripts and neither the budget...If we do get such roles, then I'm sure we women are nowhere lesser than males," she added.

162.title: When there's a bit of extra pace, it's kryptonite for Shreyas Iyer: Hogg
162.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said that India batter Shreyas Iyer is not comfortable against quicker deliveries. Hogg added, "When there's a little bit of extra pace, it's still a little kryptonite for Iyer...he tries to move around to put the bowler off." He further said, "We'll just see how he develops his game in the Tests [against Sri Lanka]."

163.title: Ukraine releases list of army losses suffered by Russia, says 5,700 Russian soldiers killed
163.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday released the list of army losses suffered by Russia, with its Defence Minister saying, "It's only indicative estimates. But it illustrates well the situation of the occupier. The enemy is demoralised, he's in agony." The list states that the Russian army lost 5,710 soldiers, 29 aircraft, 29 helicopters, 198 tanks and two warships among other things.

164.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer backs his car into a wall, receives injuries to chest & face
164.article_body: The singer of the viral song 'Kacha Badam', Bhuban Badyakar, met with an accident on Monday and received injuries to his face and chest. He was trying to back his vehicle when he rammed it into a wall in his native West Bengal. Badyakar was reportedly injured while learning to drive his recently-purchased car.

165.title: Nadella wrote about how his son Zain's cerebral palsy changed him in his book
165.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella in his book 'Hit Refresh' wrote about how his son's cerebral palsy helped him understand people of all disabilities. He wrote that visits to Zain's hospital gave him an outlook on how Microsoft technologies helped improve the medical space and that his work "transcended business". Being an empathetic father made him a "better leader", he added.

166.title: 7 women arrested for smuggling liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur district
166.article_body: Seven women from Jharkhand were arrested for smuggling country-made liquor in Bihar’s Bhagalpur district, Senior Superintendent of Police, Babu Ram, said. The excise department was tipped-off that these women were coming to Bhagalpur on a passenger train for selling liquor in the garb of herbal items. The women were arrested at Sabaur Railway Station and 200 liquor bottles were recovered.

167.title: Sweeper steals ₹33 lakh cash at sub-post office in Hyderabad, arrested
167.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Sunday arrested a man for allegedly stealing ₹33 lakh cash at a sub-post office in Hyderabad. The accused, who worked as a sweeper at the post office, had allegedly broken the grills to gain entry into the premises, police said. After committing the theft, he set the post office ablaze, police added.

168.title: Bomb squad starts searches over reports of explosives at Gurugram home
168.article_body: After reports of the presence of explosives and ammunition at a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31 on Tuesday, police started a search operation. Residents of nearby houses were asked to vacate their homes. The DCP Gurugram (East) said, "The bomb disposal squad is following protocol and only after their probe is complete, we'll be able to ascertain any details."

169.title: Ukraine warns residents of mysterious 'X' symbols appearing on buildings
169.article_body: The Ukrainian authorities have warned people to check for mysterious symbols on their buildings, presumably marked as targets for Russian airstrikes. Some of these symbols include bright red X-marks and arrows that have been spotted on rooftops and gas pipes. A Ukrainian mayor has also asked residents to paint and close access to the roof if marks are found.

170.title: Russian missile strikes near Kharkiv's administration building, Ukraine govt shares video
170.article_body: A Russian missile struck near an administration building of Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of the missile attack. "Russia is waging war in violation of international humanitarian law. Kills civilians, destroys civilian infrastructure. Russia's main target is large cities that are now fired at by its missiles," it wrote.

171.title: Sister would've loved it and cried: Benedict on 'Hollywood Walk of Fame' star
171.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch spoke about her sister Tracy Peacock after being honoured with Hollywood Walk of Fame star. "She would have loved this...She would have just been laughing nonstop all the way through, and probably crying," he said, adding, "I hope somewhere up there, where the real stars shine, you're looking down on this moment now. I'm sure you are."

172.title: Rohit is amazing, he connects to every individual: Shreyas
172.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised captain Rohit Sharma, stating that the 34-year-old connects to every individual. "Rohit is amazing. He thinks from a player's point of view. He has got that mindset...I respect him a lot," Iyer added. "We have played together at the domestic level a lot...So, it's a good space to be around," he further said.

173.title: Australia facing more floods, droughts due to global warming: Scientists
173.article_body: Climate scientists warned that global warming is leading to catastrophic weather events in Australia like bushfires, floods, droughts, heatwaves and storms. This is leading to deaths, injuries, financial and emotional stress globally, they added.
