Many of these risks could be potentially avoided if we reduce our greenhouse gas emissions and strengthen our adaptation responses, they believe.

174.title: Video appears to show Ukraine farmer towing away Russian tank with tractor
174.article_body: A video has surfaced online that appears to show a Ukrainian farmer towing away a Russian tank with his tractor. The video was shared on Twitter by former Ukrainian Ambassador to Austria, Olexander Scherba, who wrote, "Ukrainians are tough cookies indeed." In the video, a man, believed to be a Russian soldier, runs after the vehicle.

175.title: Laser treatment mentioned in wife's termination letter was for a skin condition: Ashneer
175.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who quit the company days after his wife was sacked alleging 'misappropriation of funds', called his wife's sacking "not just injustice, but male chauvinism at best." Ashneer said, "In the termination letter, they have mentioned a laser treatment." He added, "My wife had a skin condition...that bill is a private bill. She paid for it."

176.title: Telangana budget session to begin without Governor's address
176.article_body: The Telangana Assembly's budget session will not have the mandatory address by Governor this year, as per notification issued by the state government. This is the first time that the Governor won't be addressing a joint session before the budget presentation. The decision is taken due to a face-off between CM KCR and the BJP government, a TRS leader said.

177.title: Rainwater on highways to be used for power generation across K'taka: CM
177.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai said that water flowing along the National Highways will be used for power generation across the state. The project will be implemented along the stretch from Karnataka's Kittur to Belagavi, which reaches up to the Maharashtra border, he added. "Robust development will be seen by implementing Jal Shakti project along all the highways," Bommai tweeted.

178.title: Medical student, 3 others held in TN for sexually assaulting minor over 1 month
178.article_body: Four persons, including a medical student, have been arrested in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for allegedly repeatedly sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl over a period of one month. The accused also allegedly introduced her to drugs, police said. The 20-year-old dental student had befriended the girl through Instagram. Later, she was also sexually assaulted by the student's three associates.

179.title: Russia tells TikTok not to recommend military content to minors
179.article_body: Russia has asked TikTok not to show military-related content in recommended posts for minors. The Russian regulator Roskomnadzor said it had identified content on TikTok showing Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine and a lot of them being anti-Russian in nature. TikTok has restricted access to Russian state media outlets RT and Sputnik across the EU.

180.title: Bitcoin briefly rises above $44,000 for the 1st time since Feb 17
180.article_body: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was briefly trading above $44,000 for the first time since February 17 on Tuesday. It rose as much as 6% to $44,183 and was later trading at around $43,400. The surge came amid growing demand for cryptocurrencies following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and escalating sanctions on Russia.

181.title: Not a beggar: Ashneer on receiving any compensation after quitting BharatPe
181.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover on Tuesday resigned from the company. When asked if he was offered any monetary compensation by the board, he responded, "I am not a beggar. The board can't even look me in the eyes. I am not at their mercy. They are at our mercy." He also said that he'll be a shareholder at the company.

182.title: Do you think I listen to anyone's advice?: Ashneer on his decision to quit BharatPe
182.article_body: Ashneer Grover, while responding to a journalist’s query if his decision to resign from BharatPe was a personal one or advised by his lawyer, said, "Do you think I listen to anyone’s advice?...God has given me my mind and I have enough courage to take decisions on my own." He added, "I am Ashneer Grover...I'm not answerable to anyone."

183.title: Maha man gets death sentence for kidnapping, raping and killing minor
183.article_body: A special fast track court in Maharashtra convicted a 38-year-old man of raping and killing a two-and-a-half-year-old girl and awarded him a death sentence. According to the public prosecutor, the convict had kidnapped the minor, raped her and strangled her to death in February 2021. As many as 11 bite marks were found on the girl's body, he added.

184.title: Sri Lanka extends visas for Russian & Ukrainian tourists amid war
184.article_body:
The Sri Lankan government has approved a proposal by the Tourism Ministry to extend the validity of visas for Russian and Ukrainian tourists in the country for two months without any additional charges. 
This comes amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. There are 11,463 Russians and 3,993 Ukrainian tourists currently in Sri Lanka, according to the Tourism Ministry.

185.title: Sand artist creates Lord Shiva sculpture with 23,000 rudraksha beads
185.article_body: On occasion of Mahashivratri, Odisha sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a sculpture of Lord Shiva with 23,436 rudraksha beads. The sculpture has been made on Puri beach. The nine-foot-high and 18-foot-wide installation was erected on Monday. "A war is going on. We pray to Lord Shiva for global peace," he said.

186.title: Mamata inaugurates Kolkata Book Fair, requests peace outside Russian stall
186.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee inaugurated the 45th International Kolkata Book Fair on Monday. In view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Mamata urged that no one should stage a protest in front of a bookstall set up by Russia. Police have been deployed around the stall. "Protest against war, but don't protest on the book fair ground," she said.

187.title: Indian grey hornbills released in Gir forest after nearly 8 decades
187.article_body: Gujarat forest department reintroduced 20 Indian grey hornbills in the Gir forest nearly after 82 years after they vanished from the forest. Ornithologist Late R S Dharmakumarsinhji had suggested reintroducing the birds in Gir as they play a pivotal role in the forest ecosystem, sanctuary superintendent said. They were captured from northern India and released in three batches into forest.

188.title: I'm stunned by your performance: Varun praises Alia for Gangubai Kathiawadi
188.article_body: Varun Dhawan praised actress Alia Bhatt for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Taking to Instagram Stories, he wrote, "I'm...so happy and stunned by your...brilliant performance and this beautiful film. Every technician, every person who worked on it deserves every bit of the accolades they're getting." Actors including Samantha Prabhu and Ranveer Singh also praised Alia's performance.

189.title: He is dangesh, not Akhilesh: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
189.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that on one hand, PM Narendra Modi is running "Mission Ganga" to bring back the stranded Indians from Ukraine, while on the other, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav ran "Mission Danga" (riots) during his tenure as CM. "He is not Akhilesh but dangesh. More than 700 riots took place under his government," Chouhan added.

190.title: Central Railway earns ₹443.35 crore from scrap disposal
190.article_body: The Central Railway has earned ₹443.35 crore for the financial year 2021-22 up to February this year by selling scrap, officials have said. Central Railway's General Manager Anil Kumar Lahoti said the sale of scrap also helps in keeping railway premises clean. According to officials, these scrap materials include scrap rails, permanent-way materials, condemned coaches, wagons, locomotives, etc.

191.title: She was semi-conscious, said 'want to go home to protect Viku': Vikas on sister
191.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna said his sister Radhika Khanna, who passed away on Monday, kept telling doctors she wants to go home "to protect Viku" even when she was semi-conscious. Vikas shared a video including several of his pictures with Radhika on Instagram. He also said that they were getting ready for her kidney transplant and that he was "perfect donor".

192.title: Alia Bhatt got paid ₹20 cr for 'Gangubai..', Ajay received ₹11 cr for his cameo: Reports
192.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who played the titular role in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' got paid ₹20 crore for the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial, as per reports. Actor Ajay Devgn, who played the role of Rahim Lala as a cameo in the film, received ₹11 crore, reports added. As per Moneycontrol, the film was created on a budget of ₹100 crore.

193.title: Mandhana scores fifty as India Women defeat WI in WC warm-up match
193.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana smashed 66 runs off 67 balls as India Women defeated West Indies by 81 runs in their second warm-up match ahead of the ICC Women's 2022 ODI World Cup. India posted 258 with Mandhana and Deepti Sharma crossing the 50-run mark. Pooja Vastrakar then picked three wickets to help India restrict WI to 177/9 in 50 overs.

194.title: GM, Harley-Davidson halt shipments to Russia amid ongoing war
194.article_body: General Motors and Harley-Davidson have halted their shipments to Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine and the resultant economic sanctions. GM cited "a number of external factors, including supply chain issues and other matters beyond the company's control". Harley-Davidson relied on Europe and the Mideast for 31% of motorcycle sales last year.

195.title: Death toll in Jharkhand boat accident rises to 14 as 6 more bodies found
195.article_body: Six more bodies were recovered by the NDRF on Monday taking the death toll in Jharkhand's boat accident to 14, officials said. "The first body was recovered on Saturday, seven on Sunday and six on Monday," DC Faiz Aq Ahmed Mumtaz said. On February 24, a boat capsized in the Damodar river in Jamtara district after which several went missing.

196.title: New York man wins $10 million lottery for the 2nd time in 3 years
196.article_body: A New York man has won a $10 million lottery prize for the second time in three years. Juan Hernandez had won the same amount in 2019, lottery officials said. "I'm still trying to spend the $10 million I won in [2019]," Hernandez said, adding that he'll be donating the money from his second lottery win to people in need.

197.title: Russian President Putin stripped of honorary black belt by World Taekwondo
197.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has been stripped of his honorary black belt by World Taekwondo in response to his invasion of Ukraine. Putin was conferred the black belt in 2013. "World Taekwondo strongly condemns the brutal attacks on innocent lives in Ukraine, which go against the World Taekwondo vision of Peace is More Precious than Triumph," it tweeted.

198.title: Germany to spend €100 billion on defence amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
198.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that the country would sharply increase its spending on defence to €100 billion in 2022. Germany's entire defence budget by comparison was €47 billion in 2021. Germany is sending defensive anti-tank weapons, surface-to-air missiles and ammunition to Ukraine, with Scholz saying, "There could be no other answer to Putin's aggression."

199.title: After Amul, Gowardhan milk prices increased by ₹2 per litre
199.article_body: A day after Amul increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre, Parag Milk Foods has raised the price of Gowardhan brand of cow milk by ₹2 per litre with immediate effect. "This price hike is being done after almost 3 years due to rise in costs of energy, packaging, logistics and cattle feed," Chairman Devendra Shah said.

200.title: Man slaps couple for objecting to abuses on road in Guj, complaint filed
200.article_body: A man, Nitin Bhojkar, filed complaint against unknown man in Gujarat after he slapped Nitin and his wife in road rage incident. The man's car overtook Nitin's car and stopped in front of it. Nitin was forced to apply breaks, after which man stepped out and abused Nitin. He slapped Nitin and his wife when she tried to intervene.

201.title: Ilker Ayci declines offer to be new Air India CEO
201.article_body: Former Chairman of Turkish Airlines, Ilker Ayci, has rejected Tata Sons' offer to be Air India's new CEO. Ayci alleged that his appointment to the position was "coloured" by Indian media, Bloomberg reported citing an email. Earlier, RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch opposed the appointment of Ayci, who was Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's advisor in 1990s, citing "national security".

202.title: UK blocks Russian ships from its ports over Ukraine invasion
202.article_body: The UK has ordered its ports to not "provide access to any Russian flagged, registered, owned, controlled, chartered, or operated vessels" in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The maritime sector is fundamental to international trade and we must play our part in restricting Russia's economic interests and holding...Russian government to account," UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said.

203.title: Twitter to label tweets having content from Russian state media
203.article_body: Twitter will be labelling and reducing the visibility for tweets containing content from Russian state-affiliated media websites like RT and Sputnik. Twitter said that since Russia invaded Ukraine last week, it had seen more than 45,000 tweets a day from people sharing these links. Earlier, Twitter had been restricted across every major Russian telecom provider amid the ongoing conflict.

204.title: Aayush suffered severe cramp during his Da-Bangg Tour performance: Reports
204.article_body: At the Dubai show of Da-Bangg Tour, actor Aayush Sharma reportedly suffered from a cramp on the stage during his performance. However, the actor still continued his act and only stopped after completing the performance. According to a source, "Aayush showed impressive levels of commitment for his performance at...Dabangg Tour...Aayush [was] in immense pain, but he still didn't stop."

205.title: Delhi's air quality in Feb this year was cleanest for the month since 2017
205.article_body: This year, Delhi has recorded the cleanest air for the month of February since 2017, as per Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) bulletins. Delhi recorded an average AQI of 224 throughout February, cleaner than the previous low of 241 recorded in February 2020. The average AQI for the month of February was 287 in 2021 and 267 in February 2017.

206.title: Why is Ukraine a popular choice for Indians to study medicine?
206.article_body: Ukraine is a popular choice for Indian medical students who don't get a seat in government medical colleges or who can't afford private colleges in their country. Getting admission in Ukrainian colleges is comparatively easier. There is no mandate to clear any entrance as well. Annual fee of a medicine course in Ukraine is around ₹2.5 lakh to ₹4 lakh.

207.title: Ukraine compares Putin and Zelenskyy amid war, shares pic
207.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a picture comparing their President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin amid war. "Two leaders, two worlds...Freedom will prevail," it wrote. Comparing their locations, Ukraine shared a picture of Zelenskyy from a street in Kyiv, while writing that Putin is in some "unknown bunker".

208.title: They should not lose hope: Bangar on Rahane, Pujara getting dropped
208.article_body: Ex-Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara should not lose hope of getting back into the Test squad. "There are question marks raised on their future...[but] they [should] go back and continue playing domestic cricket," Bangar stated. Rahane, Pujara along with Ishant Sharma and Wriddhiman Saha were dropped for Sri Lanka Tests.

209.title: IPCC warns of potential malaria outbreak in Himalayan region
209.article_body: In India, the IPCC has projected changes in the spatial distribution of malaria, warning of a potential outbreak in the Himalayan region, besides the southern and the eastern states. The IPCC released its report on Monday. As temperatures rise, the number of months suitable for transmission of Malaria will grow, the report stated.

210.title: Pic meant to inspire people, not joining military: Ex-Miss Ukraine as gun pic goes viral
210.article_body: After her picture with a gun went viral on social media amid war with Russia, Former Miss Grand Ukraine Anastasiia Lenna clarified, "I am not a military, just a woman, just normal human...All pictures in my profile to inspire people." She further said that she is holding an airsoft gun. Earlier, reports claimed that Lenna has joined fight against Russia.

211.title: Microsoft to remove RT's news apps, ban Russia state-owned media ads
211.article_body: Microsoft has said that it will remove Russian state-owned media outlet RT's mobile apps from the Windows App store and ban Russian state-sponsored media's advertisements. It will also not display any state-sponsored RT and Sputnik content and de-rank their search results on Bing. "This has become both a kinetic and digital war," Microsoft said on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

212.title: No eyewitness doesn't mean accused not guilty: Punjab and Haryana HC
212.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that merely the absence of an eyewitness in a case does not mean that the accused is not guilty. HC dismissed a petition challenging the conviction of a man in a double murder case. A Rohtak court had sentenced the man to life imprisonment for murdering his wife and his son.

213.title: SRK fans abused me, said 'Why did he get the girl': Deepak on 'Kabhi Haan...'
213.article_body: As 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa' completed 28 years on February 25, actor Deepak Tijori said due to film's unconventional ending, Shah Rukh Khan's fans abused him. "Some...fans of Shah Rukh abused the hell out of me. They complained, 'Isko kyun mil gayi ladki'." "And of course, he (Shah Rukh) gets a bigger star in the end (Juhi Chawla)," he added.

214.title: US working with allies to seize Putin's assets: American Senator
214.article_body: The US and allies are coordinating to not only freeze the assets of Russian President Vladimir Putin and his oligarch allies, but to seize those assets as well, said Senator Chris Murphy, who is a member of the Foreign Relations Committee, amid Russia's attack on Ukraine. "This is likely a further step than Putin's inner circle anticipated," he added.

215.title: West using Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy as pawn against Russia: Syria
215.article_body: Syrian Deputy Foreign Minister Bashar Jaafari has said that the western countries are using Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as a pawn for their own strategic interests. "Zelenskyy is being used as a pawn of the West in strategic interests, and [the West] is now undermining his reputation by drawing him into a conflict with Russia," said Jaafari.

216.title: Earthquake of magnitude 3.4 hits Gujarat's Kutch
216.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 3.4 on the Richter Scale was recorded in Gujarat's Kutch district on Tuesday. According to the Institute of Seismological Research (ISR), the tremor was recorded at 7:50 am with its epicentre 19 km west south-west of Rapar in Kutch. Notably, three tremors of magnitude 3.4 have been recorded in the district in last two weeks.

217.title: Spoke to you in 2011, you seemed kind, stop this madness: Ex-NASA astronaut to Putin
217.article_body: Former NASA astronaut Scott Kelly has voiced his concern over the situation in Ukraine following Russia's invasion. "Mr Putin, in 2011 I spoke with you from the ISS after my brother's wife was shot.  You seemed kind and sincere...You can stop this madness," he tweeted. "I'm afraid for the Ukrainians and for my Russian friends. Everyone will lose," he said.

218.title: CCS teams reformed in Hyderabad to track major fraud
218.article_body: The Central Crime Station (CCS) of Hyderabad Police has bought in major reforms in all its teams to control the increasing number of specialised crimes. The CCS teams will take up cases where fraud of over ₹75 lakh is reported. Under the upgraded apparatus, each police station will be attached to an additional inspector of the detective department.

219.title: Tharoor's view personal: Congress clarifies stand on Ukraine
219.article_body: Senior Congress leader Anand Sharma said that Shashi Tharoor's criticism of the government over abstaining from UNSC procedural vote calling for an emergency General Assembly session on the Ukraine situation was "personal". Strong words must not be used, Sharma added. Earlier, Tharoor said, "After our abstention, many regretted that India had placed itself on the wrong side of history."

220.title: Hope Virat Kohli celebrates his 100th Test with a ton: Gavaskar
220.article_body: Talking about the first Test between India and Sri Lanka which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test, Sunil Gavaskar said he hopes Kohli celebrates reaching the milestone with a century in the match. "Not many batsmen have...[scored a century in their 100th Test]. Kohli's been fabulous," added Gavaskar. Kohli last scored a century in international cricket in November 2019.

221.title: I was quietly relaxed inside: Ashwin recalls Sangakkara's retirement
221.article_body: Talking about Kumar Sangakkara, Ravichandran Ashwin admitted he was "happy" about Sangakkara's retirement, having dismissed him a "few times". "All these big batters when they get out to a certain bowler, they...come out hungrier, trying to dominate you," said Ashwin. "I was quietly relaxed inside that he will not come up front and battle against me again," added Ashwin.

222.title: Leave Kyiv urgently today: India to its nationals in Ukraine
222.article_body: In a new advisory, the Indian Embassy in Kyiv said, "All Indian nationals including students are advised to leave Kyiv urgently today. Preferably by available trains or through any other means available." Earlier today, seventh flight carrying 182 Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai. A Russian military convoy stretching for around 64 km is nearing Kyiv.

223.title: Praying for peace in our world: Ronaldo on Russia's invasion of Ukraine
223.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to criticise Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We need to create a better world for our children. Praying for peace in our world," he wrote. Meanwhile, Manchester United have cancelled their £40million sponsorship deal with Russian airline Aeroflot. "We share the concerns of our fans around the world," said the club.

224.title: Toshiba CEO resigns amid growing opposition to restructuring plans
224.article_body: Toshiba CEO Satoshi Tsunakawa has resigned from his position amid reported growing internal opposition to its restructuring plans. Senior executive Taro Shimada, a former Siemens AG executive, who joined Toshiba in 2018, will become the new interim head of the company effective March 1. Toshiba's initial plan was to split it into three units but it was revised last month.

225.title: Turkey warns countries against passing warships through its straits
225.article_body: Turkey has warned countries against passing warships through its Bosphorus and Dardanelles straits amid Russia-Ukraine war. It invoked the 1936 Montreux Convention which lets it restrict naval transit through its straits during wartime. "We implemented what Montreux says and we will do so from now on. There has been no request for passage through straits until today," said the government.

226.title: 39-year-old man shoots his 3 daughters before killing self in US church
226.article_body: A 39-year-old man shot and killed his three daughters and a fourth person before taking his own life in a church in US' California. "The shooter was estranged from his daughters' mother, who'd a restraining order against him," police said. Investigators believe the shooting took place during a supervised visit with the children and the fourth victim was their chaperone.

227.title: When I didn't answer, they made answer of their own: Ankita on Sushant's death
227.article_body: Hinting at late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death, actress Ankita Lokhande said she was "constantly being questioned". "When I wouldn't answer, they would make answer of their own...Vicky and I faced a lot," she said. Meanwhile, talking about her husband Vicky Jain, she said, "Not everyone has capability to stand with their woman through...difficult time. He was there throughout."

228.title: Shark Tank judge's Sugar Cosmetics in talks to raise $50 mn: Report
228.article_body: Sugar Cosmetics is in talks to raise over $50 million at a valuation of about $500 million, Moneycontrol reported. The round will be led by L Catterton Asia, an investment firm partnering with Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy (LVMH). Sugar Cosmetics was co-founded by Kaushik Mukherjee and Vineeta Singh, who was a judge on Shark Tank India.

229.title: Undertrial arrested in harassment case dies in police custody in Thane
229.article_body: An undertrial who was arrested in a case of harassment on February 26, died in police custody in Maharashtra, officials said. The deceased, identified as Dattatreye Warke, was kept in an isolation cell at Manpada police station. Warke suffered from a seizure and fell on the ground after which he was rushed to hospital where he died, the police added.

230.title: What's allowed and what's not allowed as U'khand revises COVID-19 guidelines?
230.article_body: Amid declining cases of COVID-19, the Uttarakhand government has announced certain relaxations in the state effective from March 1. The state government has allowed swimming pools and water parks to reopen from Tuesday. All offices in the state can now operate with full capacity. However, political rallies and demonstrations remained prohibited until March 10.

231.title: Cybersecurity incidents rising due to delayed awareness among people: MoS IT
231.article_body: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said India is dealing with the increase in cybersecurity threats by revamping its policies and focusing on existing systems, such as strengthening CERT-In, to address the challenges that come its way. "Cybersecurity incidents are on the rise due to...delayed awareness among people on the issue of cybersecurity," Chandrasekhar added.

232.title: We were getting ready for transplant, I was perfect kidney donor: Vikas on sister's death
232.article_body: Celebrity chef Vikas Khanna took to Twitter following his sister Radhika's death and revealed they were getting ready for her kidney transplant. "I was the perfect kidney donor. Post surgery we both wanted to visit Varanasi," he added. "Will have to learn from today on to how to live in this world without a sister," he wrote in another tweet.

233.title: Watched 'Satte Pe Satta' at least 50 times just to see Big B's entry: Nagraj
233.article_body: National Award-winning filmmaker Nagraj Manjule, who directed 'Sairat' and has directed Amitabh Bachchan's upcoming film 'Jhund', said he has watched Amitabh's 'Satte Pe Satta' at least 50 times just to see the actor's entry sequence. "I would watch three-four film shows of his in a single day. Every second of working with Bachchan sir was precious," added Nagraj.

234.title: I challenge you to run this company better without me: Ashneer to BharatPe board
234.article_body: While resigning as BharatPe's MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover said in a letter to the board, "Since you clearly believe you can run this company better without me – I'm leaving you with this challenge." "Build incrementally even half of the value I created so far," he wrote. He added that he'll continue as BharatPe's single largest individual shareholder.

235.title: Centre shares list of 1,786 Haryana students in Ukraine, 91 brought back
235.article_body: The Central government shared a list of 1,786 students from Haryana studying in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the state government said that so far, 91 students have been brought back. A few students have reportedly returned to India with their own efforts even before the war broke out. Haryana had received nearly 1,000 evacuation requests from state residents in Ukraine.

236.title: Ukraine Prez's wife posts pic of newborn, says 'This child was born in bomb shelter'
236.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's wife Olena Zelenska shared a picture of a newborn and wrote, "This child was born in Kyiv bomb shelter." "This was to take place in completely different conditions, under peaceful skies. It's what children should see," she added. "Despite the war, there were doctors and caring people on our streets next to her," she added.

237.title: 7th flight carrying 182 Indians evacuated from Ukraine lands in Mumbai
237.article_body: The seventh flight carrying 182 Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai from Romania's Bucharest on Tuesday as part of 'Operation Ganga'. Union Minister Narayan Rane received the Indian nationals at the Mumbai international airport. The eighth flight carrying 216 Indian nationals has departed from Hungary's Budapest for New Delhi, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.

238.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's son Zain dies aged 26
238.article_body: Microsoft has said that son of Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella, Zain, died on Monday morning. He was 26 years old and had been born with cerebral palsy. The software maker told its executive staff to hold the family in their thoughts and prayers while giving them space to grieve privately.

239.title: Arjun shares pics from Luv Ranjan's wedding featuring Ranbir; tags Alia
239.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Arjun Kapoor shared pictures from Luv Ranjan's wedding in Agra. A few pictures were from filmmaker's Haldi ceremony where Ranbir Kapoor can be seen giving a peck on Luv's cheek. He also shared a picture of Ranbir looking at the Taj Mahal from the place they were staying at. Arjun, however, tagged Alia Bhatt in the picture.

240.title: SpaceX wins 3 more ISS crew flights, NASA deal value hits $3.49 bn
240.article_body: NASA has awarded SpaceX three additional crew flights to ISS, bringing SpaceX's total Commercial Crew Transportation Capability contract to $3.49 billion. SpaceX now holds contracts for nine such missions out of which three have been fulfilled since 2020. Prior to the update, SpaceX was contracted to fly three more missions, Crew-4 and Crew-5 in 2022 and Crew-6 in 2023.

241.title: Man issues rape threat to actress, says police can't arrest him; held in Pune
241.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Pune for issuing rape and kidnapping threats to a 20-year-old actress, police said. The accused had two girlfriends and he suspected she would inform them about the double dating, police added. The man told her police will not be able to arrest him, police stated. The girl met the man online, police further said.

242.title: No Indian will be left behind in Ukraine: Union Minister VK Singh
242.article_body: Union Minister and former Army Chief General VK Singh said that no Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine will be left behind "if he/she gets into trouble''. "If you don't have the patience and don't follow the instructions, things can go wrong," Singh added. Singh is among the four ministers who have been nominated for the evacuation mission by Centre.

243.title: Price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinder increased by ₹105 in Delhi from today
243.article_body: The prices of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders have been increased by ₹105 in Delhi, effective from March 1. With this increase, now 19 kg commercial cylinder will cost ₹2,012 in the national capital. The price of 5 kg commercial LPG cylinders has also been raised by ₹27. Now a 5 kg cylinder will cost ₹569 in Delhi.

244.title: Russia has fallen behind its Ukraine war timeline: US Senator
244.article_body: US Senator Chris Murphy said he was told during a classified briefing that "Russians have fallen behind their timeline" for Ukrainian invasion due to "fierce" resistance by Ukraine and "multiple Russian equipment and logistics failures". Murphy added, "Russia will try to encircle and cut off Kyiv in...next several weeks", and the fight for Ukraine's capital will be "long and bloody".

245.title: Disney, Warner Bros, Sony pausing film releases in Russia over Ukraine invasion
245.article_body: Hollywood studios Disney, Warner Bros, and Sony Pictures Entertainment said they would pause theatrical releases of upcoming films in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The Walt Disney said it is pausing the release of theatrical films, starting with the upcoming Pixar Animation Studios release, 'Turning Red'. WarnerMedia said it would pause this week's release of 'The Batman' in Russia.

246.title: Ashneer quit ahead of PwC report, board reserves right to take action: BharatPe
246.article_body: After BharatPe's Ashneer Grover resigned as MD and director, BharatPe said he resigned "minutes after receiving the agenda for upcoming board meeting that included submission of the PwC report regarding his conduct". "The Board reserves the right to take action based on the report's findings," the company added. Co-founder Ashneer said he was being "forced to bid adieu" to BharatPe.

247.title: Woman who dressed in men's clothes to commit thefts in Mumbai arrested
247.article_body: A 24-year-old woman, who used to dress in men's clothes to commit thefts in the western suburbs of Mumbai, has been arrested. Police said according to a driver, who lodged a complaint, the accused put a blade in her mouth and threatened to harm herself when he tried to stop her from stealing his car, along with her aides.

248.title: Gujarat Titans' ₹2-crore buy Jason Roy pulls out of IPL 2022
248.article_body: England batter Jason Roy, who was bought by Gujarat Titans for ₹2 crore in IPL mega auction, has reportedly pulled out of IPL 2022 citing bio bubble fatigue. This is the second time Roy has pulled out of the tournament after being picked in the auction. In 2020, Roy opted out of IPL after being picked by DC.

249.title: I tried to act relaxed but couldn't control emotions: Shreyas on IPL auction
249.article_body: Newly-appointed KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he tried to act relaxed but couldn't control emotions while watching the IPL mega auction, where he was bought by the franchise for ₹12.25 crore. "My heart was pumping...I was feeling a little nervous. Eventually, KKR got me, that feeling was amazing," he stated. "I'm really proud...coming in KKR setup," he added.

250.title: PM Modi extends best wishes on Maha Shivaratri
250.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend his best wishes to the countrymen on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. "Best wishes to all of you on the auspicious occasion of Mahashivratri. May the God of gods, Mahadev bless everyone. Om Namah Shivay," PM Modi tweeted.

251.title: Sydney warned of 'one-in-a-thousand year event' of rains, floods
251.article_body: Australia's Met department has warned that Sydney could face heavy rains and flash floods over the next two days. It said that the city could receive rainfall up to six inches within six hours on Tuesday. Terming it a "one-in-a-thousand year event", New South Wales Premier Dominic Perrottet said the residents should be prepared to evacuate on short notice.

252.title: Parents accompanied me for shoots in India; felt independent in the US: Madhuri
252.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said her parents accompanied her to film sets in India but she felt independent in the US. "I grew up in a...protected environment...But once I got married, I began making decisions by myself." "I learnt a lot...because of living in the US...When I was in India, there would...be...20 people fussing over me at all times," she said.

253.title: Nagaland allows one-time age relaxation for entry into govt service
253.article_body: Nagaland has announced one-time age relaxation for entry into government service for a period of two years starting from April 22, 2021, on Monday. "This will be one-time relaxation due to the COVID-19 pandemic and disruption in recruitment activities on account of the ban of appointments," an office memorandum from Chief Secretary of the state, J Alam, stated.

254.title: Assam Police seize 570 grams of heroin in Morigaon, 1 held
254.article_body: Assam Police on Monday seized 570 grams of heroin in Morigaon district, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma wrote on Twitter. One accused from the neighbouring state was arrested during the operation at Jagiroad, he added. Earlier, Assam Police had recovered 1.04 kg of Heroin worth ₹7 crore in the Karbi Anglong district.

255.title: Ukraine shares screenshot of alleged last chat between Russian soldier and his mother
255.article_body: Ukrainian government shared screenshot of an alleged chat of a Russian soldier with his mother moments before he was killed. In the exchange, the soldier tells his mother he's not doing training exercises. When his mother asks if she can send a parcel, he says "I want to hang myself". He explains he's in Ukraine, where there's a "real war".

256.title: $2.4-bn fraud accused Indian founder of BitConnect has disappeared: US regulator
256.article_body: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Founder Satish Kumbhani, charged criminally in the US for running a $2.4-billion ponzi scheme, has disappeared from India, officials said. The 36-year-old Kumbhani has "likely relocated from India to an unknown address in a foreign country", SEC attorney Richard Primoff said in a court filing. US SEC has been attempting to locate him since November.

257.title: Western Railway to run Holi special super fast trains from Mumbai
257.article_body: The Western Railway in Mumbai has decided to run Holi special super fast trains at a special fare. The trains will run between Mumbai Central- Jaipur-Borivali [Train No. 09039/09040], Bandra Terminus-Bhagat Ki Kothi- Borivali [Train No. 09035/09036] and Bandra Terminus- Bhavnagar Terminus- Bandra Terminus [Train No. 09005/09006]. Each of these trains will make two trips.

258.title: Canada comedian flies to Ukrainian border to serve as combat medic; shares video
258.article_body: Canada comedian Anthony Walker has traveled to the Polish-Ukrainian border to serve as a combat medic. Walker, who described himself as "temporary Ukrainian", shared a video on Twitter. "This war affects everyone...I would go to fight for the freedom that Ukrainians deserve, my family deserves, and you deserve," he said.

259.title: ED summons Nawab Malik's son Faraz in money laundering case
259.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's son Faraz Malik in connection with the Dawood Ibrahim-linked money laundering case. BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis had earlier alleged that Faraz was the signatory on a property deal involving Dawood's aide. Nawab Malik has approached Bombay HC seeking to dismiss the money laundering case against him.

260.title: If Putin wants to kill himself, he should do what Hitler did in 1945: Ukraine's UN envoy
260.article_body: During UN General Assembly's session on Ukraine crisis, Ukraine's UN Ambassador Sergiy Kyslytsya described Vladimir Putin's order to put Russian nuclear forces on alert as "madness". "If he wants to kill himself...he doesn't have to use...nuclear arsenal, he has to do what the guy in Berlin did in a bunker in 1945," Kyslytsya said referring to Adolf Hitler's suicide.

261.title: Americans don’t need to worry about nuclear war: US Prez amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
261.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that Americans don't need to worry about a nuclear war. This comes amid ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine with the former putting nuclear deterrent forces on alert. A White House official earlier said, "We are assessing President Putin's directive and at this time, we see no reason to change our own alert levels."

262.title: Tripura High Court bans sale of meat products in public places
262.article_body: Tripura High Court banned the open sale of meat on streets or in public places in the state. It has also asked the Agartala Municipal Corporation ( AMC) to work on a long-term plan for setting up a slaughter house in Tripura. "Particular attention should be kept that hygienic conditions are being maintained within the licensed premises," court further added.

263.title: Police exhume body of Bengal student leader Anish Khan for 2nd post-mortem
263.article_body: West Bengal Police on Monday exhumed the body of student leader Anish Khan for a second post-mortem, nine days after the 28-year-old was allegedly murdered by men dressed in police uniform in Howrah. The Calcutta High Court had on February 24 ordered a second post-mortem amid concerns that the first examination of the body was carried out inaccurately.

264.title: B'luru civic body seeks police support in drive against illegal banners
264.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought support from the city police in the drive against illegally installed flexes and banners. "The support of police is needed to take legal action and to prevent any unwanted incident during the drive," BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said on Monday. City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has reportedly assured cooperation.

265.title: Pune reports 44 dengue, 270 suspected chikungunya cases in 2 months
265.article_body: The cases of dengue and chikungunya are on rise in Pune as the city reported 44 positive cases of dengue, 270 suspected cases and 24 confirmed cases of chikungunya from January to February 25. "Surge in cases now could be due to various reasons among people who live near water bodies," Dr Sanjeev Wavare, Assistant Health Officer at PMC said.

266.title: High levels of PM2.5 reported in several parts of Bengaluru: Study
266.article_body: High levels of air pollution were recorded in several parts of Bengaluru, a report by Center for Study of Science, Technology and Policy (CSTEP) said. The study used satellite-based products to monitor hotspots, rural-urban contrasts of PM2.5 across Delhi-NCR, Kanpur and Bengaluru in 2019. As per the study, Rajarajeshwari Nagar and South zone recorded highest levels of PM2.5 in Bengaluru.

267.title: We can't abandon ties with Russia or Ukraine: Turkish Prez Erdogan
267.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey can't abandon its ties with Russia or Ukraine amid Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Turkey shares a maritime border with both Ukraine and Russia. Turkey on Sunday had called Russia's invasion a "war", allowing it to invoke parts of an international treaty that will limit the passage of some Russian vessels from Turkish straits.

268.title: Video shows aircraft flying close to Taj Mahal, ASI seeks report from CISF
268.article_body: A video showing an aircraft flying in the no-flying zone of Taj Mahal surfaced on social media on Monday. The 16-second video shows the aircraft flying close to the monument. "We have sought a written report from the CISF officials with regard to the viral video of the aircraft," said Raj Kumar Patel, Superintending Archaeologist of the ASI, Agra Circle.

269.title: Won’t rest till our fellow Indians are safe: Jaishankar amid Ukraine war
269.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine war, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said that the Centre "will not rest" until the Indians stuck in Ukraine are safe. "We will not rest till our fellow Indians are safe. Ninth Operation Ganga flight departs Bucharest for New Delhi with 218 Indian nationals," Jaishankar tweeted today morning.

270.title: BJP moves Calcutta HC seeking re-elections to 108 civic bodies in WB
270.article_body: BJP has moved Calcutta High Court seeking re-elections to all 108 civic bodies in West Bengal alleging violence during the voting on Sunday. There had been a "complete distortion of law and order", BJP stated in the petition. BJP's West Bengal unit on Sunday wrote to the State Election Commissioner demanding the municipal polls "to be declared null and void".

271.title: J&K people don’t rule themselves, bureaucrats from UP & Guj rule them: Rahul
271.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that today, the people of Jammu and Kashmir don't rule themselves but bureaucrats from UP and Gujarat rule them. "In Punjab, they have unilaterally taken away 100 kms of land and gave it to BSF. Our vision is unity in diversity while theirs is unity through conformity," Gandhi added.

272.title: DND-sector 12/22 route to be made signal free with help of 5 U-turns
272.article_body: Noida authority's traffic cell has started work to make route from the DND flyway to sector 12/22 signal free. Officials said U-turns will be made at five locations along route. "Work for U-turn in front of petrol pump located in Sector 21A has begun...U-turns will be made at five more intersections where currently traffic signals are located," an official said.

273.title: Building contractor kidnapped, shot at by 3 bike-borne men in Ludhiana
273.article_body: A building contractor was kidnapped by three bike-borne men from a market in Ludhiana. They took control of his car at gunpoint and forcefully drove towards Jhande village, where they threw him out of his car. When he resisted and caught hold of one of them, they shot him and fled. A passerby rushed him to a hospital.

274.title: UK oil giant Shell to exit all joint ventures with Russia's Gazprom
274.article_body: British oil giant Shell will exit all its joint ventures with Russian government-controlled energy company Gazprom and related entities. Its assets in these ventures are worth about $3 billion. Shell will also stop working on the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project. Describing Russia's actions in Ukraine as "a senseless act of military aggression", Shell said, "We will not stand by."

275.title: Manipur Congress candidate arrested over violence at polling booth
275.article_body: Congress candidate Dr Lamtinthang Haokip, who is contesting from Manipur's Saitu seat, was arrested on Monday for allegedly causing violence at a polling booth. Haokip has been accused of carrying lethal weapons to the booth and destroying EVM and other equipment. The security personnel reportedly had to resort to firing in the air to disperse the mob.

276.title: Signal calls hacking rumours false, sees rise in East Europe usage
276.article_body: Messaging platform Signal has said that the messages saying that its platform has been "compromised and hacked" is false. Signal said the rumours are part of a coordinated misinformation campaign "meant to encourage people to use less secure alternatives". Signal said it saw an uptick in usage in Eastern Europe in the backdrop of Russia's Ukraine invasion.

277.title: Noida man arrested for posing as magazine editor, blackmailing woman
277.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 33-year-old Noida man for posing as a Russian magazine editor and harassing women after convincing them to share private photos. The accused Mohit Sharma allegedly approached a woman online and asked her to share private photos on pretext of using them in magazine. Sharma allegedly threatened her to upload them online if she didn't share more.

278.title: Truck carrying LPG cylinders rams into shanty in Ludhiana; 2 injured
278.article_body: Two people suffered minor injuries after a truck laden with LPG cylinders rammed into a shanty near Ludhiana's Pakhowal Road flyover on Monday. The incident took place after the truck hit a wall near the flyover. Police have seized the truck and the reason behind the mishap is being investigated.

279.title: My son has no idea about the negative things going on in my marriage: Nisha
279.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal spoke to Karanvir Bohra about the domestic violence incident that allegedly broke her and her estranged husband Karan Mehra's marriage. She revealed that her son Kavish does not have any idea about the "negative things" going on in their marriage. Nisha said whenever her son talks about his father, she makes sure to embrace him.

280.title: How much prize money has new world no. 1 Russia's Medvedev won in his tennis career?
280.article_body: Russia's Daniil Medvedev on Monday became the new world number one men's tennis player, overtaking Novak Djokovic. The 26-year-old had turned pro in 2014 and he has won 13 titles so far, including one Grand Slam. In 2022, he has won a prize money of $1,713,615. Overall, Medvedev has won a prize money of $23,350,971 in his career.

281.title: US expels 12 Russian UN diplomats, citing 'espionage activities'
281.article_body: The US has expelled 12 members of Russia's UN mission from America for being "intelligence operatives". The US mission to the UN said diplomats had been "engaging in espionage activities that are adverse to our national security". The expulsions have been "in development for several months" and are in accordance with the US' agreement with the UN, the mission said.

282.title: SBI stops handling trade with sanctioned Russian entities: Report
282.article_body: India's largest lender State Bank of India won't process any transactions involving Russian entities that have been sanctioned after the invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a letter. "Transactions involving entities, banks, ports or vessels appearing" on a US, European Union or United Nations sanctions list won't be processed irrespective of the currency used, SBI told certain clients.

283.title: India reports 6,915 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate falls below 1%
283.article_body: India has reported 6,915 new COVID-19 cases and 180 deaths in the last 24 hours. Out of the 180 deaths, 99 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 20 were reconciled deaths in Goa and 61 in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The daily positivity rate went down from 1.11% to 0.77%.

284.title: Chhattisgarh govt to buy cattle urine from owners to 'augment income'
284.article_body: Chhattisgarh government is making plans to procure cattle urine from cattle owners. Officials said this would augment their income and will lead to "better cow protection". "Cattle urine will be procured in same manner as cow dung...We will procure cattle urine through Gram Gauthan (cattle shed) Samiti...fortnightly payments will be made to cattle owners, farmers," advisor to Chief Minister said.

285.title: 19-yr-old who tracked Musk's jet creates Twitter account to track Russian billionaires
285.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old college student, who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, has now created a Twitter account to track aircraft of Russia's billionaires as they come under international pressure over the country's invasion of Ukraine. "The aircrafts these oligarchs have are absolutely crazy. Their planes are huge compared to other jets," Sweeney told Bloomberg.

286.title: Earlier heroines in their 30s played mothers of some heroes: Lara
286.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta said there was a time when women over 30s were considered for the role of "mothers" of some heroes. She added that now, age-appropriate roles are being written in the industry. "If [heroines] were over 55, [they]...[played] grandmother...or [played] the long-suffering wife," Lara said. "The entire cohort of women between 35 and 55 were...rarely seen," she said.

287.title: 3, including juvenile, held for killing man in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
287.article_body: Three people, including a juvenile, were arrested for allegedly killing a 25-year-old man in Jamia Nagar, police said. The incident took place on Friday following a fight over playing 'gilli danda'. In a video, recorded by the locals, a group was purportedly seen assaulting the victim with sticks. The victim succumbed to his injuries while getting treated at a hospital.

288.title: Police catches 38-yr-old man, minor with pistol & knife at checkpoint in Surat
288.article_body: A 38-year-old man was arrested and a 16-year-old boy was sent to a juvenile home after police in Surat recovered a country-made pistol and a knife from the minor’s bag at a vehicle checking point. They were travelling on a two-wheeler when the police stopped them at Soham circle in the Khatodara area.

289.title: Congress acts like it is Muslims' kin: K’taka minister Eshwarappa
289.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa said the Congress acts like they are "relatives of the Muslims". "We (BJP) are for Hindus but Congress cannot even say we are for Muslims. The Congress acts like they are relatives of the Muslims," Eshwarappa added. He had earlier said that Bajrang Dal activist, Harsha, was killed by "Musalmaan goondas" (Muslim goons).

290.title: Bengaluru street art festival Chitra Santhe to be held on March 27
290.article_body: The 19th edition of the popular Bengaluru street art festival, Chitra Santhe, will be held on March 27. The theme of the event will be devoted to the freedom fighters as India celebrates the 75th anniversary of Independence. The Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, which organises the festival, expects around 1,500 artists from across the country to participate.

291.title: Man and his mother make wife drink floor cleaner in Pune, booked
291.article_body: Pune Police on Monday booked a man and his mother for the attempted murder of his wife by making her drink floor cleaner at their house in Hadapsar area. The incident had allegedly taken place on February 12, police said. The in-laws were demanding ₹2 lakh from her parents to pay EMI of a home loan, the victim said.

292.title: It was a huge hit but I didn't have money for rent after it: Ronit on 'Jaan...'
292.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy said that his debut film 'Jaan Tere Naam' was a huge hit but "stardom was elusive". "I didn't even have money to pay rent even after the film...post the release and hit at the box office, there was no call, no phone, no flowers, no reaction from the industry for three weeks," Ronit said.

293.title: Int'l Ice Hockey Federation bans Russia, Belarus 'until further notice'
293.article_body: The International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) has suspended Russian and Belarusian teams from its competitions "until further notice" and has stripped Russia of the 2023 World Junior Championship hosting rights over its invasion of Ukraine. "We were incredibly shocked to see the images that have come out of Ukraine," IIHF President Luc Tardif said in a statement.

294.title: Over 1 lakh Covishield vaccine doses set to expire in Pune by March
294.article_body: Over one lakh doses of Covishield vaccine across 51 private vaccination centres in Pune are set to expire by March, said Dr Sanjay Patil, Chairman of IMA Hospital Board of India, Pune chapter. States/UTs were asked to consider exchange of near expiry vaccine vials by the Centre but Maharashtra has ruled out an exchange of the doses, Dr Patil claimed.

295.title: Australian cricketer Agar's wife receives death threat for husband ahead of Pak series
295.article_body: Australian cricketer Ashton Agar's wife Madeleine received a death threat for her husband on social media ahead of the Pakistan series. "This is a warning for your husband Ashton Agar if he comes to tour against Pakistan he won’t come [back] alive," part of the message read. Officials have said that it doesn't seem to be a credible threat.

296.title: CISF personnel rescues 9-yr-old girl stuck on narrow ledge at Delhi metro station
296.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was rescued by a CISF personnel after she got trapped behind a grill on a narrow ledge at the Nirman Vihar metro station in Delhi. Officers said the girl was playing around the stairs and jumped towards another side, but got stuck on the ledge around 15-20 feet above the ground.

297.title: Netflix not to add govt-run channels to Russian service, defying law
297.article_body: Netflix has refused to add government-run channels to its Russian service, despite a regulation that would require it to distribute them, amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Given the current situation, we have no plans to add these channels to our service," Netflix said. The regulation requires audiovisual services with more than 1,00,000 subscribers to distribute 20 free-to-air channels.

298.title: Bengaluru to face water supply disruption on March 3
298.article_body: Several parts of Bengaluru will face disruption in water supply on March 3 as authorities will carry out pipeline-linking work across the city. The disruption will continue from 6 am to midnight. The Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board said that a 1,350 mm pipeline from Cauvery near Gubbalala will be linked to 18 million litre capacity reservoir in Banashankari.

299.title: You treat founders as slaves, cut us down at will: Ashneer to BharatPe investors
299.article_body: In his letter of resignation as BharatPe MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the company's investors and board treat founders as "slaves", pushing "us to build multi-billion-dollar businesses and cutting us down at will". "Today I'm being vilified and treated in the most disgraceful manner...I cease to be a human for you (investors)," he added.

300.title: 5-yr-old boy dead, 3 injured as balcony of shopping centre collapses in Mumbai
300.article_body: A five-year-old boy died and three others were injured after a portion of a balcony of a shopping centre collapsed in the Kurla West area of Mumbai on Monday afternoon, an official said. The incident took place on Ram Manohar Lohia Marg at a two-storey structure, he added. The injured persons are currently undergoing treatment.

301.title: It's unfair: Bhagyashree's daughter on being compared to Ananya & Janhvi
301.article_body: Speaking about being compared to actresses Ananya Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor, actress Bhagyashree's daughter Avantika Dassani, who starred in show 'Mithya', said the comparison isn't fair. "I don't think there should be a comparison," she added. "You should look at every artist for the work they do and their performance. We shouldn't be comparing artists with each other," Avantika said.

302.title: No one from my family was at my wedding, parents didn't agree: Bhagyashree
302.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that no one from her family was present at her wedding with husband Himalay Dassani. "And same was the case with my husband. When I told my parents that I want to get married to him, they didn't agree," she said, adding, "Parents should allow the kids to live their dreams."

303.title: India abstains from voting at United Nations Human Rights Council on Ukraine crisis
303.article_body: India was among the 13 countries that abstained from voting at the United Nations Human Rights Council session to hold an urgent debate on Ukraine crisis. Ukraine said Russia was attempting to sow panic among the population by specifically targeting kindergartens, orphanages and hospitals. The vote was passed by 29 out of the Council's 47 members voting in favour.

304.title: Canada bans crude oil imports from Russia amid Ukraine invasion
304.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has announced a ban on imports of crude oil from Russia in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The oil revenues have "benefited Russian President Vladimir Putin and his oligarchs greatly", Trudeau said. "Even though Canada has barely imported any Russian oil and gas in recent years, this move sends a powerful message," he added.

305.title: Will be disappointing to have no crowd: Gavaskar on Kohli's 100th Test
305.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it'll be disappointing to have no crowd for the first Test against Sri Lanka, which is also slated to be ex-captain Virat Kohli's 100th Test. "The 100th Test is very very special...but I think the decision has been taken in the greater interest," Gavaskar added. Kohli has scored 7,962 runs in 99 Tests.

306.title: 64-km-long Russian convoy nears Ukraine's Kyiv, pics surface
306.article_body: Satellite pictures showing a Russian military convoy stretching for around 64 km nearing Ukrainian capital of Kyiv have surfaced online. The convoy is substantially longer than the 27 km reported earlier, Maxar Technologies said. The company also said additional ground forces deployments and ground attack helicopter units were seen in southern Belarus, less than 32 km north of Ukraine border.

307.title: Elon Musk sends Starlink satellite internet terminals to Ukraine, Vice PM shares pic
307.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to reveal that SpaceX Starlink satellite internet terminals have arrived in Ukraine amid war with Russia. "Starlink - here. Thanks, @elonmusk," he wrote. He also shared a picture of a vehicle carrying the terminals. Fedorov had asked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for assistance on Saturday.

308.title: Delhi government reduces COVID-19 beds as cases fall
308.article_body: Delhi government has started reducing COVID-19 beds in hospitals as cases have started declining. The number of COVID-19 beds on February 24 stood at 15,294, and it was reduced to 11,089 on February 27. "We had made arrangements to increase the beds up to 1,00,000 if the need arose," an official said. COVID-19 bed occupancy on February 27 was 1.62%.

309.title: BMC to install new bus shelters with movable benches in Mumbai's suburbs
309.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has decided to refurbish and install new bus shelters at 105 locations in Mumbai's suburban belt. New shelters will have movable metal benches clamped on footpath. The benches will have a transparent enclosure which will help with visibility for the passengers. Officials said that the new shelters will consume less space and will be visually appealing.

310.title: Russia used vacuum bomb during invasion: Ukraine ambassador to US
310.article_body: Oksana Markarova, Ukraine's ambassador to the US, told reporters that Russia had used a thermobaric weapon, known as a vacuum bomb, in its invasion of her country. "The devastation that Russia is trying to inflict on Ukraine is large," she said. There has been no official confirmation that thermobaric weapon has been used in the conflict in Ukraine.

311.title: Ashneer Grover quits as BharatPe MD, says 'I'm being forced to bid adieu'
311.article_body: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover, who's in a tussle with the board over a governance review, has resigned as MD and director. In his letter, Ashneer said, "I write this with a heavy heart as...I'm being forced to bid adieu to a company of which I'm a Founder." Earlier, his wife Madhuri was fired as Head of Controls on funds misappropriation allegations.

312.title: 4 alleged media persons extort money from woman in Ujjain, booked
312.article_body: Four alleged media persons have been booked for extorting money and valuables from a woman in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh. The accused, who're all on the run, have been identified as Shubham Bamne, Pooja Solanki, Dharmendra Parmar and Omprakash Pal. The group had allegedly extorted cash and other items from a house after receiving information about a sex racket running there.

313.title: Duo posing as police flee with man's gold chain in Powai, booked
313.article_body: Two persons have been booked for cheating a senior citizen in Powai by posing as police and running away with his gold chain. The duo had caught the 60-year-old retired BMP employee without a mask and questioned him before fleeing with his chain worth ₹45,000 on Sunday morning. A case was registered under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

314.title: Viral magazine covers showing Putin with Nazi symbol, Hitler moustache are fake
314.article_body: Two photoshopped images purporting to show Russian President Vladimir Putin as German dictator Adolf Hitler on the cover of TIME magazine, have been going viral online, amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. One of the covers features Hitler's eyes merged with Putin's face with a swastika. The other one shows Hitler's iconic toothbrush moustache on Putin's face.

315.title: Ukrainian soldiers who told Russian warship 'go f*** yourself' are alive: Navy
315.article_body:
A group of 13 Ukrainian soldiers thought to have died while defending an island in the Black Sea after telling a Russian warship to “go f*** yourself”, are alive and well, confirmed the Ukrainian navy. 
However, they have been illegally captured by the Russians, it added. They were thought to have been among the first victims of the Russian invasion.

316.title: PMC to construct 100 MT solid waste management plant in Pune
316.article_body: A solid waste management project is to be set up at a ten-acre independent plot of Cantonment Board located in Pune's Hadapsar Industrial Estate. The project has been approved by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for a cost of ₹20 crore. Out of the total, ₹7.50 crore have been sanctioned for constructing a 100 metric tonne processing plant.

317.title: FIFA & UEFA suspend Russia from all international football competitions
317.article_body: FIFA and UEFA have suspended Russian teams from international football competitions "until further notice" amid its invasion of Ukraine. The FIFA World Cup was scheduled to be held in Qatar later this year. UEFA will also cancel its sponsorship deal with the Russian gas company, Gazprom. "Football is in full solidarity with...the people affected in Ukraine," read their statement.

318.title: Defeat BJP to get rid of inflation: Chhattisgarh CM
318.article_body: Ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Monday urged the people of the state to defeat BJP to get rid of inflation. While addressing a gathering in UP's Sardarnagar area, he said, "The rates of diesel and petrol will skyrocket after the elections are over." He added, "Mehengai hatao, bhajpa harao."

319.title: NCP, Cong protest against Maha Guv's remarks on Shivaji Maharaj
319.article_body: The NCP and Congress on Monday held agitations in Pune to protest against the remarks made by Maharashtra governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari in Aurangabad. Koshyari, while speaking on importance of teachers, had allegedly stated that Samarth Ramdas was the guru of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Meanwhile, BJP MP Udayanraje Bhonsle, who is a descendent of Shivaji, also criticised the statement.

320.title: Delhi reports 258 COVID-19 cases & zero deaths in last 24 hrs
320.article_body: Delhi reported 258 new COVID-19 cases and no related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,59,892. Moreover, 499 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,845 active cases. With no death in the last 24 hours, the fatality count in Delhi remains at 26,122.

321.title: Bureaucrats from UP & Guj rule people of J&K today: Rahul Gandhi
321.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Chennai, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that bureaucrats from Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat rule the people of Jammu and Kashmir today. He further said, "In Punjab, they unilaterally took away 100 km of land and gave it to the Border Security Force (BSF)." Gandhi added that Congress' vision is "unity in diversity."

322.title: Akhilesh protected, embraced terrorists as CM of UP: JP Nadda
322.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav 'protected and embraced terrorists' during his tenure as the Chief Minister of UP. Nadda said that BJP has taken strict measures against such elements after 2017. There's a rule of law in UP now, he further added.

323.title: Policeman attacked by suspected militants in J&K's Srinagar
323.article_body: A police inspector was attacked by suspected militants in the Batamaloo area of J&K's Srinagar on Monday, police said. The policeman, identified as Sheikh Firdous, was returning from a local mosque after offering prayers when he was fired upon, police added. He is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital and his condition is said to be stable.

324.title: 28 more Bihar students return from Ukraine on Monday
324.article_body: Twenty-eight more students from Bihar arrived in Patna on Monday from Ukraine, just a day after 23 students from the state returned home. According to Patna district administration officials, the students arrived in three batches. Patna district magistrate Dr Chandrashekhar Singh said all returnees were provided free of cost vehicles to transport them to their respective native places.

325.title: PM running 'Mission Ganga', Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas': MP CM
325.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan while addressing a rally in Jaunpur on Monday, claimed that "700 riots" took place in UP during Akhilesh Yadav's rule. Further describing the Samajwadi Party chief as "Dangesh" he said, "PM Modi running 'Mission Ganga' (to evacuate Indians from Ukraine) while Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas' (riots)." Chouhan had earlier compared Akhilesh to Aurangzeb.

326.title: UN Security Council imposes arms embargo on Yemen's Houthi rebels
326.article_body: UN Security Council on Monday imposed an arms embargo on Iran-backed Houthi rebel groups of Yemen. Proposed by UAE, the measure expands a targeted embargo on several Houthi leaders to the whole group. This comes after the group claimed multiple drone and missile attacks in UAE and Saudi Arabia this year. With 11 votes in favour, the resolution was passed.

327.title: Burman family makes offer to buy additional 26% stake in Eveready
327.article_body: Eveready's single-largest investor Burman family on Monday said it made an open offer to buy an additional 26% stake, or 18.9 million shares, for ₹604.76 crore in Eveready Industries Ltd. The mandatory open offer under the takeover regulations was made as the Burmans acquired an additional 5.26% share of Eveready for ₹122.30 crore, taking their total shareholding to 25.11%.

328.title: My soulmate left me today: Chef Vikas Khanna shares post after sister's death
328.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna on Monday shared a post to mourn the death of his sister, Radhika Khanna. Sharing a photo, Khanna wrote, "My soulmate left me today...She fought like a champion for years with Lupus, aHUS, renal failure. But today due to multiple organ failures, my best friend passed away in my arms. Loveeeee you Radha forever & forever. RIP."

329.title: In a policy shift, Finland to send weapons to Ukraine amid invasion
329.article_body: Finland will send weapons and ammunition to Ukraine amid ongoing Russian military offensive, PM Sanna Marin said on Monday. The shipment will include 2,500 assault rifles,1,50,000 bullets, 1,500 anti-tank weapons and 70,000 food packages, Defence Minister Antti Kaikkonen said. The decision comes as a policy shift for Finland which has remained militarily neutral since end of World War II.

330.title: Very unusual of him: Gavaskar on Rohit's dismissal in 3rd T20I vs SL
330.article_body: Referring to captain Rohit Sharma's dismissal in third T20I against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it was "a strange and completely uncharacteristic innings" right from the first ball. "He was looking to play on the onside maybe. He's very disappointed...in this occasion, Rohit was looking to hit every ball, which is unusual," Gavaskar added. Rohit scored nine-ball five.

331.title: 600 CCTVs placed at Chandni Chowk to check encroachment: Police
331.article_body: Over 600 CCTVs have been installed at Chandni Chowk to monitor illegal vendors, Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana told the Delhi High Court on Monday. He also said that a control room would monitor the feed 24 hours every day. He further said that they would install similar cameras under Safe City Project in Delhi in the future.

332.title: UP no longer wants to be driven by casteism: PM at Ballia rally
332.article_body: PM Narendra Modi arrived in Ballia on Monday to address voters and spoke about people rejecting "dynasty politics". He further said, "[The] vehicle of UP is no longer going to get stuck in...streets of caste as it has gained momentum on...highway of development." He added he has an "emotional connect" with Ballia as the Ujjwala scheme was launched from there.

333.title: Serena Williams: Sharapova on her toughest opponent
333.article_body: Terming Serena Williams as toughest competitor she's ever faced, ex-world number one Maria Sharapova said the 23-time Grand Slam champion was the most challenging and consistent in her level. Serena has a 20-2 career record over Sharapova. She won the last 19 meetings in a row. Notably, it's the longest active winning streak over a single player on WTA Tour.

334.title: TRS leader Sajid Khan, booked for raping 15-yr-old girl, expelled
334.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader Sheikh Sajid Khan, who's on the run after being accused of rape by a 15-year-old girl, has been expelled from the party. The announcement was made by TRS on Monday, just a day after police registered a sexual assault case against Khan. Police said they're searching for him and shall "arrest him at the earliest".

335.title: EU to hold summit with China on April 1 to defuse tensions: Official
335.article_body: European Commission Vice-President Valdis Dombrovskis on Monday said that the European Union (EU) will hold a summit with China on April 1 in an attempt to defuse growing tensions between the two. "We know we're in a complicated phase of relations with China," he added. Notably, the EU regards China as a strategic rival in some fields, according to Reuters.

336.title: Students from TN, T'gana & K'taka stuck in Ukraine break down, seek help
336.article_body: Videos of Indian students stranded in Ukraine are circulating on social media. The students, reportedly from Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Karnataka can be seen breaking down on camera while describing their condition. In one of the videos, some Tamil Nadu students can be seen pleading with the government to evacuate them while talking about "acute shortage of food and water".

337.title: Nuclear conflict inconceivable: UN chief on Russia-Ukraine conflict
337.article_body: Speaking at the emergency session of the United Nations General Assembly over the Russia-Ukraine conflict on Monday, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said, "The mere idea of a nuclear conflict is simply inconceivable." Notably, Guterres was speaking in reference to Russia putting its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert amid the conflict. Guterres also called it a "chilling development".

338.title: It's a lovely journey, we are growing: Dulquer on wife Amal
338.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said it has been a lovely journey with his wife Amal Sufiya and they both are growing and learning about each other. "I completed 10 years in the industry and...10 years of marriage as well," he said. "It's about realising what keeps you together, what you want in your life together," he added.

339.title: Pop artiste Rose tests positive for COVID-19, cancels some tours
339.article_body: Pop artiste Rose, part of the South Korean pop group Blackpink, has tested positive for COVID-19, the label handling the group said in a statement on Monday. "As a result, some of her overseas schedules have been cancelled," the statement said. Rose was to travel overseas for her tour this week.

340.title: Rock band Green Day cancels Moscow concert over Ukraine crisis
340.article_body: American rock band Green Day has decided to cancel its upcoming concert in Moscow in the wake of Russia's military operation in Ukraine. "We are aware that this moment is not about stadium rock shows, it's much bigger than that...Refunds available at the point of purchase," the band said in a statement. The concert was earlier scheduled for May 29.

341.title: Man flees after attempting to rape 7-yr-old girl in Ludhiana; booked
341.article_body: A man has been booked for attempting to rape a seven-year-old girl in Ludhiana. The incident took place on February 23 in Rasulpur village in Jagraon, following which the accused ran away from the scene. The victim's father, who lodged a complaint with police, said he had found the man trying to undress the minor while in an inebriated condition.

342.title: Russia's Medvedev replaces Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player
342.article_body: Russia's Daniil Medvedev has officially replaced Novak Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player. Medvedev is the third Russian to become world number one men's tennis player after Yevgeny Kafelnikov and Marat Safin. The 6-foot-6-inch tall player is the tallest men's player to become world number one in the history of ATP rankings.

343.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at SAG Awards 2022
343.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Jessica Chastain were awarded Outstanding Performance by a Male and Female Actor in a Leading Role respectively at the SAG Awards 2022. Will won for his performance in 'King Richard' while Jessica was awarded for her role in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The film 'CODA' won Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture.

344.title: Lee Jung Jae, Jung Ho Yeon win SAG Awards 2022 for 'Squid Game'
344.article_body: Actor Lee Jung Jae has won the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series for 'Squid Game' at the SAG Awards 2022. Actress Jung Ho Yeon received the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series. The South Korean series also won in the Outstanding Action Performance as a Stunt Ensemble category.

345.title: It's truly awful: Brian Cox on Russia's invasion of Ukraine
345.article_body: At the Screen Actors Guild Awards 2022, 'Succession' actor Brian Cox termed Russian invasion of Ukraine as "truly awful". "It's particularly awful in terms of [how] it's affecting people, particularly in our profession," he said. "But the thing that really distressed me is what's happening in Russia to my fellow actors...they cannot say a word about Ukraine," Brian added.

346.title: We came with mindset to enjoy every moment: Wiese on PSL win
346.article_body: Lahore Qalandars all-rounder David Wiese said his side came with a mindset of enjoying every moment in Pakistan Super League (PSL) final after winning their maiden title with a 42-run victory against Multan Sultans on Sunday. "We had beaten Multan before in the tournament and we took confidence from that, but also it's a final...anything can happen," he added.

347.title: Centre committed towards development of North-East: Union Minister
347.article_body: Union Minister of Jal Shakti Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Monday said that the Centre is committed to the development of the North-Eastern region. While addressing the conference of State Ministers of North-Eastern Region on Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) and Swachh Bharat Mission in Guwahati, he said the state should give emphasis on maintaining quality while implementing JJM in the region.

348.title: Odisha govt bans Holi celebration in public places
