348.article_body: The Odisha government on Monday banned the Holi celebration in public places and restricted large gatherings during festivals. "People may celebrate Holi with family members in their houses only," an order issued by the state government said. Local authorities would ensure proper adherence to the COVID-19 appropriate guidelines on Mahashivratri, Holi and Dol Purnima, the order added.

349.title: Indian refuses to leave Ukraine after not being allowed to bring pet dog
349.article_body: Indian engineering student Rishabh Kaushik has refused to leave war-hit Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from the Indian government to bring his pet dog 'Malibu' with him. Kaushik, who's in an underground bunker in Kyiv, rescued the puppy last year. He said he's been in touch with the Indian embassy since February 18 to get the necessary documents.

350.title: TikTok now allows 10-minute-long videos on the app
350.article_body: TikTok has started rolling out the ability that allows users to upload videos that are up to 10 minutes long. TikTok, which began as a 15-second video app, has been gradually increasing the maximum time limit for videos and last increased the limit to 3 minutes in July 2021. Owned by Chinese internet conglomerate ByteDance, TikTok remains banned in India.

351.title: Govt must share evacuation plan with Indians in Ukraine: Rahul
351.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the Centre must urgently share the detailed evacuation plan with Indians stranded in Ukraine, as well as with their families. Referring to a video in which the Ukrainian Army can be seen using force against the Indian students, he said, "We can't abandon our own people. No parent should go through this."

352.title: Man steals motorcycle during test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana
352.article_body: A man pretending to buy a second-hand motorcycle stole it during a test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana. The complainant, who owned the bike, Yamaha R15, had posted an advertisement on a social networking site. The accused came to his house and asked him to go for a test ride first, but he did not return.

353.title: I've made many mistakes in my life, have been misunderstood: Poonam
353.article_body: Actor-model Poonam Pandey has said that she's not controversial at all in real life. While interacting with 'Lock Upp' host Kangana Ranaut in the first episode, Poonam said, "I am a normal person...I have made a lot of mistakes in my life...I have been misunderstood." Actress Nisha Rawal and comedian Munawar Faruqui are among the other contestants in the show.

354.title: Biden to host ASEAN leaders for summit in March in US: White House
354.article_body: The White House on Monday said that President Joe Biden will host the leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) for a special summit in the US from March 28-29. "It's a top priority for the Biden-Harris Administration to serve as a...reliable partner...to...ASEAN," it added. Notably, the summit was announced amid growing concerns about China in the US.

355.title: 'Putin forcing us to lie,' reads message on Russian media sites after hack
355.article_body: Several Russian media outlets, including state-owned TASS, were hacked on Monday. An anti-war message was posted on the homepage of these websites, with calls to stop Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "Dear citizens. We urge you to stop this madness, don't send your sons and husbands to certain death. Putin is forcing us to lie," the message read.

356.title: Solanki to continue playing Ranji despite losing daughter, dad in span of 2 weeks
356.article_body: Baroda batter Vishnu Solanki has decided to carry on playing Ranji Trophy despite losing his father and one-day-old daughter in a span of two weeks. Solanki lost his daughter on February 12. He returned to the team on February 17 and scored a hundred on February 25. He would feature in Baroda's next match despite losing his father on Sunday.

357.title: 10 Assam students evacuated from Ukraine, state opens helplines
357.article_body: Ten students from Assam who were stranded in war-torn Ukraine have been evacuated along with other Indians, the state government said. Two of the 10 students who have been evacuated arrived in Mumbai, and the others in New Delhi. Meanwhile, the Assam Police issued helpline numbers +91 6026900968 and +91 6026901060 (both WhatsApp) for assistance.

358.title: Will not allow weapons for Ukraine to transit our territory: Hungary
358.article_body: Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó on Monday said that Hungary will not send troops or weapons to Ukraine and will not allow lethal weapons to transit its territory in order to keep the country safe. "The reason...is that such deliveries might become targets of hostile military action," he added. "We are not getting involved in that war," he further said.

359.title: President Zelenskyy signs application for Ukraine to join European Union
359.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday signed an application for Ukraine to join the European Union. Earlier today, Zelenskyy had urged the EU to allow Ukraine to gain membership under a special procedure immediately amid the Russian invasion. "Our goal is to be with all Europeans and, most importantly, to be equal...I am sure we deserve it," he said.

360.title: Hearing good things about Bobby's performance in Love Hostel: Salman
360.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and said that he's hearing good things about actor Bobby Deol's performance in the film 'Love Hostel'. "Best wishes always and hope you keep doing better and better," Salman further wrote. Bobby and Salman worked together in the 2018 film 'Race 3'. Actors Vikrant Massey and Sanya Malhotra also feature in 'Love Hostel'.

361.title: Remarkable feat: Babar on Shaheen-led Lahore Qalandars winning 1st PSL title
361.article_body: Following Lahore Qalandars' maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title win, Pakistan captain Babar Azam congratulated them, saying it's a "remarkable feat" achieved by captain Shaheen Shah Afridi. "Amazing display of performance by both teams...I want to thank the fans for making PSL a hit!" he tweeted. Chasing a 181-run target, Multan Sultans were bowled out for 138 in 19.3 overs.

362.title: Out for a swim, 3 teens drown in stream in Andhra's Prakasam
362.article_body: Three teenagers, who went for a swim in a stream, drowned in Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam district, the police said on Monday. "Apparently, they did not gauge the depth of the stream, which was about 10 feet, and drowned within minutes," Tangutur Sub-Inspector Khadar Basha said. The bodies have been shifted to a local government hospital for a post-mortem examination.

363.title: Condition of Indian students pathetic: MP girl stuck in Ukraine
363.article_body: A student of Sumy State Medical University in Ukraine, Ishika Sarkar, who hails from Madhya Pradesh, sought help from the government of India, stating that the condition of Indian students in Ukraine has "become very pathetic". "They are spending time in bunkers in a very pathetic condition. Soon there will be crises of food, electricity and mobile network," she said.

364.title: Landslide in U'khand's Rudraprayag, families taken to safer areas
364.article_body: A landslide occurred in the hilly Jhalimath village in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag on Monday. Several cowsheds and toilets were damaged in the incident, prompting the administration to shift 11 families to safer places. A chunk of the slope beneath the village slid several hundred metres down to the banks of the Alaknanda river, District Disaster Management Officer Nandan Singh said.

365.title: I'm praying for the people in Ukraine: Actress Angelina Jolie
365.article_body: After Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday, Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie took to Instagram and wrote that she is praying for the people in Ukraine. "My focus along with my UNHCR colleagues is that everything possible is done to ensure the protection and basic human rights of those displaced, and refugees in the region," she added.

366.title: Poland-Lithuania gas link to open earlier amid Russia supply worries
366.article_body: A natural gas pipeline linking Poland and Lithuania is set to open on May 1, earlier than its scheduled start. The GIPL pipeline's inaugural was preponed due to concerns of disrupted Russian gas supply to Europe, following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe is dependent on Russia for over 35% of its natural gas, most of which is transported via pipelines.

367.title: Shaheen you're a champion: Shahid on Lahore Qalandars' PSL title win
367.article_body: Calling Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Shah Afridi a "champion" after he led his side to their maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to congratulate the "amazing" team. "The entire Qalandars squad and in fact, the entire Lahore deserves this! Buhut Mubarak," he wrote. Lahore Qalandars beat Multan Sultans by 42 runs on Sunday.

368.title: Russia bans residents from transferring money abroad from March 1
368.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a ban on foreign exchange loans and transfers by its residents to outside of the country from March 1, in response to the economic sanctions imposed by the West. It also prohibits companies from buying back their own stocks. This comes after Russia banned flights from 36 countries in a retaliatory move against EU.

369.title: BJP hatching conspiracy to end reservation: Akhilesh Yadav
369.article_body: While addressing a meeting in the Jalalpur Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The BJP is hatching a conspiracy to end reservation, and hence it is selling government organisations to the private sector." He further said the people of Uttar Pradesh have rejected BJP in the first five phases of UP polls.

370.title: I'm a player's captain, now more experienced: KKR skipper Shreyas
370.article_body: Newly-appointed Kolkata Knight Riders skipper Shreyas Iyer said he's a player's captain and wants to create an atmosphere in the team where everyone would be thinking only about winning. "I'm now more mature and experienced in terms of my decision-making and captaincy skills," he added. Shreyas was bought by KKR for ₹12.25 crore in the recent IPL mega auction.

371.title: Russia's economic reality has considerably changed: Russian govt
371.article_body: Speaking about the economic measures taken against Russia by other countries over invasion of Ukraine, the Russian government said, "The economic reality has considerably changed." "These are heavy sanctions...but Russia has the potential to offset the harm," it added. Russia has been making plans for quite a long time for possible sanctions, including the most severe ones, it further said.

372.title: 'Europeans with blue eyes, blonde hair being killed', says Ukraine official; criticised
372.article_body: While talking about the current Russia-Ukraine conflict, Ukraine's Deputy Chief Prosecutor David Sakvarelidze said, "It's really emotional for me because I see European people with blue eyes and blonde hair being killed...with (Russian President) Vladimir Putin's missiles." Sakvarelidze has been criticised for the statement with many calling it 'racist' and indicative of 'white supremacy'.

373.title: India needs to be powerful in fast-changing world: PM Modi in UP
373.article_body: While addressing voters in UP's Maharajganj, PM Narendra Modi spoke about the need for the country to remain powerful in the fast-changing world. He said, "You're witnessing the situation of a fast-changing world in...last two years. [The] world is going through several challenges....Nobody can remain untouched from this. Under this situation, it's very important for India to be powerful."

374.title: Slovakia sends missiles, rockets to Ukraine amid war with Russia
374.article_body: Slovakian Defence Minister Jaroslav Nad on Monday said Slovakia delivered two batches of supplies worth €15.4 million, including 486 air-defence missiles and anti-tank rockets to Ukraine. This comes as Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children. Nad added the country also sent 120mm artillery ammunition and fuel.

375.title: Sudan's key pro-democracy groups release 1st political charter
375.article_body: The main pro-democracy groups of Sudan on Sunday released a political charter for the first time, aiming to unify factions and bring democracy. As per charter, an appointed PM will serve as head of state and military commander-in-chief for a transition period of 2 years until a constitution is ratified. Sudan plunged into crisis after military coup in October 2021.

376.title: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
376.article_body: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."

377.title: Heroin worth ₹70 lakh seized in Haryana, 9 arrested
377.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested nine people from Jind and Sirsa districts in separate cases and seized heroin worth around ₹70 lakh from them. Of the total 669 grams seized, 514 grams of heroin was recovered from two of the accused near Belarkhan village. Preliminary probe revealed the drugs were to be supplied in Narwana, Sangrur and Patiala areas, police said.

378.title: Switzerland bans entry of 5 Russian oligarchs close to Putin
378.article_body: Swiss Justice Minister Karin Keller-Sutter on Monday said government banned five Russian oligarchs close to Russian President Vladimir Putin from entering the country. This comes after the neutral nation adopted sanctions imposed by EU against Russia after it mounted a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24. However, the minister did not name the oligarchs citing privacy concerns.

379.title: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan shares first pics of wedding with Alisha
379.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan on Monday took to social media to share the first pictures of his wedding with his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid. The couple got married on February 20 in Agra. Their wedding was attended by actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor, Rakul Preet Singh, Jackky Bhagnani, Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma, among others.

380.title: Ukraine to pay its soldiers ₹2.5 lakh per month for fighting Russian troops
380.article_body: Ukraine has announced that its soldiers will be paid 100,000 hryvnias per month (around ₹2.5 lakh) for defending against Russian forces. Families of deceased servicemen will be paid a lump sum amount of 15 million UAH (around ₹3.7 crore). As per the President, this isn't done to be thanked but to tell the defenders that Ukraine is grateful to them.

381.title: Sick, filthy: Gauahar on channel saying she fought with Shibani over Farhan
381.article_body: Gauahar Khan has criticised a news channel for reporting that she fought with Shibani Dandekar over a crush on Farhan Akhtar calling it filthy and sick. "Be...absolutely ashamed that in a time [of] war...some parts of...media...can't stop lying," she tweeted. Gauahar further wrote that she said all contestants of reality show 'I Can Do That' were crushing on host Farhan.

382.title: BSF airlifts 3 patients from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara
382.article_body: Three patients requiring immediate medical attention were airlifted by BSF from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara district on Monday. The Public Relations Officer of Kashmir Frontier said the district administration had made a special request for their evacuation as the only road passing through Sadhna top was closed. "We're always there to serve people of Kashmir," IG of BSF Kashmir said.

383.title: After calling Vikrant 'cockroach', Kangana wishes him on marrying a Himachali
383.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut wished actor Vikrant Massey on marrying Sheetal Thakur on Instagram, commenting, "Hmm Vikrant ji marrying a Himachali girl is good karma. Wish you both a happy married life." She had earlier called Vikrant a 'cockroach' after he commented on actress Yami Gautam's picture dressed in traditional Himachali bridal attire writing, "Pure and pious like Radhe Maa."

384.title: Delhi HC refuses to entertain plea to change title of 'Prithviraj'
384.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea seeking to modify the title of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj'. The bench of judges said that they were inclined to dismiss the plea with costs after which the plea was withdrawn. The submitted plea had stated that Prithviraj was a great emperor and the title should be more respectful.

385.title: Don't feed stray dogs, monkeys on court premises: Delhi High Court
385.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday directed advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel to not feed stray animals like monkeys and dogs within its premises. The court said that it had come to notice that some advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel were still feeding stray animals in spite of directions issued against it.

386.title: Luxembourg to send anti-tank weapons to Ukraine amid war with Russia
386.article_body: Luxembourg Defence Minister François Bausch on Monday said the government will send 100 NLAW anti-tank weapons, jeeps and 15 military tents to Ukraine. This comes after EU on Sunday decided to fund military weapons for Ukraine to help it defend itself against Russian invasion. At least 352 civilians including 14 children were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

387.title: New Zealand to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated arrivals
387.article_body: New Zealand is set to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated nationals returning to the country from Thursday onwards, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said. Incoming travellers will still need to test negative for COVID-19 before leaving and after arriving. The revised rule, however, does not include tourists as New Zealand hasn't opened its borders for international tourism yet.

388.title: Putin is a warmonger, tyrant & also kind of a huge b***h: John Oliver
388.article_body: Talking about Russian President Vladimir Putin, comedian John Oliver said, "He's an autocrat, a tyrant, a warmonger. But also, he's kinda...huge b***h." Oliver's comments were in response to a video of the security meeting where Putin ordered Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service chief Sergei Naryshkin to "speak plainly" on the matter of recognising Donetsk and Luhansk as 'People's Republics'.

389.title: PM Modi chairs 3rd high-level meeting in 24 hours on Russia-Ukraine conflict
389.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held the third high-level meeting within 24 hours on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, on Monday evening. The meeting was attended by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar along with Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju, Hardeep Puri and VK Singh. Scindia, Rijiju, Puri and Singh will be sent to Ukraine's neighbouring nations to oversee Indians' evacuation.

390.title: 8 yrs ago, universe did us a solid: Ankita on anniversary with Milind
390.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor-model Milind Soman's wife Ankita Konwar shared pictures with the actor to mark eight years of togetherness. "On this day, eight years ago, the universe did us a solid and it continues to work its charm every single day," she captioned the post. Milind and Ankita got married in April 2018 after dating for five years.

391.title: Moldova new land route to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine: MEA
391.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said a new route through Moldova has been identified for evacuation of Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the new route is operational and the Ministry's team is ready to assist those in need. "They will assist in the evacuation of Indians through Romania," Bagchi said.

392.title: Let's not politicise the evacuation process: Ex-PM Devegowda
392.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda on Monday said the evacuation of Indians stuck in Ukraine must not be politicised. "It will demoralise those conducting the operation. Scoring points at this hour of crisis will make us look bad," Devegowda said. "It is only fair that we support our officers and embassies to focus on the job at hand," he added.

393.title: BJP crossed majority mark in UP after 5 phases of polls: Shah
393.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday claimed the BJP has already gone past the majority mark after the first five phases of polling in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "In the sixth and seventh phases, people have to vote for the BJP to form the government with over 300 seats," he said at an election rally.

394.title: 15 booked after Panchkula trader ends life in Ludhiana hotel
394.article_body: The Ludhiana Police on Sunday booked 15 persons for abetment to suicide after a Panchkula-based trader ended his life over being allegedly harassed by his business associates. Sub-Inspector Jaskanwal Singh Sekhon said the victim was found dead in his hotel room on February 25. The police had found two pills and a suicide note from his room.

395.title: Urgent to end talks to revive Iran nuclear deal this week: France
395.article_body: France's Foreign Ministry on Monday said that it is urgent to end negotiations to revive a 2015 nuclear deal between world powers and Iran this week. The talks are being held in Austria's Vienna. Separately, Iran said that efforts to revive the deal could succeed if the US took a political decision to meet its demands.

396.title: Russian President Putin calls West an 'Empire of Lies' after sanctions
396.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin called the West an "Empire of Lies" following the economic sanctions imposed by countries like the UK and those in EU. "PM Mikhail Mishustin and I discussed this...bearing in mind the sanctions the so-called Western community...as I called it in my speech, the 'empire of lies' - is now trying to implement against Russia," Putin said.

397.title: Don't be aggressive at railway stations: Advisory for Indians stuck in Ukraine
397.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine requested Indian nationals, students stuck amid war to "remain calm, peaceful and united". Warning of large crowds at railway stations, the embassy advisory said, "It's advised that all Indian students remain patient, composed and especially not to exhibit aggressive behaviours while at the railway stations." Delays in trains and cancellations are expected, it added.

398.title: How much prize money did PSL 2022 winners get as compared to IPL 2021?
398.article_body: Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 winners Lahore Qalandars won a cash prize of PKR 80,000,000 (around ₹3.4 crore), while Indian Premier League 2021 champions Chennai Super Kings had won ₹20 crore. Further PSL 2022 runners-up Multan Sultans got a cash prize of PKR 32,000,000 (₹1.37 crore), while IPL 2021 runners-up KKR received a prize money of ₹12.5 crore.

399.title: 3-day Urs of Shah Jahan begins at Taj Mahal in Agra
399.article_body: The three-day Urs of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan started at the Taj Mahal in Agra on Sunday. Portals of the Taj Mahal basement housing the original graves of Shah Jahan and his consort Mumtaz Mahal were opened for visitors on the occasion. Entry to Taj Mahal was free from 2 pm on Sunday and will remain the same on Monday.

400.title: One of the most amazing experiences: Watson on playing in Pakistan
400.article_body: Terming playing in Pakistan as one of the most "amazing" experiences of his life, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he was fortunate to play a few matches of Pakistan Premier League in the country. The 40-year-old represented Islamabad United and Quetta Gladiators in PSL. Meanwhile, Australia will be playing an all-format series in Pakistan after 24 years, beginning March 4.
